title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Would you like to take part in shaping the future of Mobile payment? Do you enjoy mixing app development and integration customer support? Then Crunchfish is the company you are looking for. We are currently growing our team and searching for a Full Stack Developer.
  
  

About you
  
You have a bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience. Through your experience, you have a solid technical background, an agile mindset and have worked with iOS and Android development for at least 3 years in production with high focus on low-level- and security development. To be successful you need an open mindset with focus on collaboration and quick to adapt to new circumstances. As a person, you are a positive team player that want to contribute to a work environment that is built on curiosity, creativity and care.
  
  

We would like you to have
  
* 3+ years of software experience in iOS and Android development
* Experience of native development in iOS and Android (C/JNI)
* Strong understanding of PKI and cryptographic operations
* Experience in app security and penetration testing
* Ability to engineer clear, modular, maintainable code in Swift/Kotlin/C/Rust
* Ability to write full covered tests in Python/Swift/Kotlin/C/Rust
* Interest in best practices for iOS and Android development
* Passion in the domain of the OS integrity & vulnerabilities
* Passion for the quality of the software you design, deliver and maintain


Extras you might have
  
* Experience in developing products for financial industry
* iOS and/or Android UI development experience
* Server-side Rust development
* Knowledge on documenting SDKs/APIs for external use
* Experience of maintenance and development of CI/CD pipeline


What’s in it for you?
  
Working with Crunchfish is likely a great step in your career as you will be working hands-on in complex and fast-moving projects together with sharp brains and access to market-proven software and tools. Our sweet spot is in securing connections and payments between mobiles and as part of our team at Crunchfish, you will get to work hands-on with a variety of companies and industries worldwide with an initial focus in India.
  
  

Welcome to Crunchfish
  
Crunchfish is a deep tech company developing a Digital Cash platform for Banks, Payment Networks, Payment Services and CBDC implementations. Crunchfish is listed on Nasdaq First North Growth Market since 2016, with headquarters in Malmö, Sweden and with representation in India.
  
  

Ready for the new challenge?
  
The search- and selection process is ongoing so please submit your application by submitting your CV and your application to hiring R&D Director rutger.petersson@crunchfish.com as soon as possible.

title: Team "TRAC" Fullstack Developer - 100% Remote (from anywhere in Europe) (m/f/d)
description:
**Are you a highly skilled full-stack engineer with a passion for creating exceptional user experiences? We’re looking for someone with strong expertise in backend-end technologies (PHP, Symfony) and a solid foundation in frontend-end development (Angular, VueJS) to join our Platform Traffic & Conversion team at Digistore24. In this role, you will shape the customer experience of our e-commerce platform while driving overall business growth. If you thrive in a dynamic environment and are eager to innovate, we want to hear from you.**

 **Who is Digistore24?**


Join one of Europe’s fastest-growing tech companies, dedicated to shaping the digital future. We empower entrepreneurs worldwide by providing innovative e-commerce solutions and expert guidance to help them turn their visions into successful businesses. Our company is built on a foundation of creativity, innovation, and a passion for technology. At Digistore24, you’ll be a part of a vibrant, forward-thinking team that values individuality, sustainability, and collaboration while working to make a real impact in the digital landscape from anywhere you call home.

**Your new dream job**


As a full-stack engineer with Digistore24, you will:

* **Drive significant global impact:** Shape the user experience for thousands of customers daily with your full-stack expertise.
* **Demonstrate Strategic Business Thinking**: You are product-minded and take ownership of your work. You want to understand the problem, the business case, and make pragmatic decisions.
* **Elevate Customer Experience:** Lead the development and refinement of our e-commerce platform to ensure to have the best converting order form in the market.
* **Innovate in Developer Experience:** Creating an efficient architecture to allow easy maintenance and fast feature development
* **Collaborate With Experts:** Partner closely with product managers, UX/UI designers, and platform developers to bring cohesive and innovative solutions to life.
* **Contribute to Engineering Excellence:** Build on a proven expertise with PHP as well as one or more modern frameworks (Symfony, Lavarel). Conduct thorough code reviews, refactor legacy components, and propose strategic improvements to modernize our evolving codebase.
* **Mentor and Lead:** Share your backend-end expertise with the team, fostering a culture of continuous improvement and technical excellence.
* **Work With an International Team**: You are fluent in both written and spoken English to communicate clearly. Our fully-remote work environment requires excellent and proactive communication to keep everyone on track!

**Your benefits at Digistore24**


Here are just a few of the great reasons to join us:

* Enjoy the flexibility of working from your **home office**, provided you have uninterrupted internet access.
* Benefit from regular **further education and continuous learning** opportunities.
* Experience the stability of a highly successful German high-tech company, **funded by its product success** and not by its investors.
* Work in **outcome-focused teams** with a culture of direct feedback.
* Utilize **modern equipment** in a flexible and international work setting.
* Engage in **spectacular team events** across various European countries.
* Enjoy **autonomy** from day one, with a friendly, informal atmosphere.
* Benefit from **flexible working hours** from Mondays to Fridays.

 **Your superpower**

* **Strategic business thinking:** You don't need to know every detail of how to solve a problem, because you understand the business case behind it and you can make pragmatic decisions
* **Code refactoring expertise:** You are able to tackle legacy code and make small refactorings without breaking it
* **Problem-solving mentality:** You take ownership of a task and will do whatever is necessary to finish it. Yes, you understand yourself as a problem solver via code, not a coder.
* **Master of great code quality:** You understand code quality outside of frameworks
* **Communication skills:** You are fluent in both written and spoken English to communicate with our international team
* **Extensive technology stack:**


	+ Strong proficiency in PHP/Symfony
	+ **Very strong** expertise in Angular, TypeScript and Jest (or other comparable **Front-end** languages like React or Vue)
	+ Experience in test-driven development
	+ Deep knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3, including CSS methodologies (BEM, SMACSS) and CSS preprocessors like SASS or LESS.
	+ Experience with web performance optimization techniques and ensuring cross-browser compatibility.
	+ Exposure to automated testing frameworks for front-end applications beyond Jest, such as Cypress or Selenium, is a plus.

**This position is NOT for you if you**

* … have less than 3 years of experience in software development
* … view software development as only the activity of code writing
* … cannot write high quality code without a modern framework or need Windows to develop
* … casually make changes to code without understanding their consequences
* … can’t take ownership and need to discuss every detail with your product manager or colleagues
* ... do not have the ambition to continuously expand your knowledge
* ... do not identify with **our values**
* ... lack collaboration and teamwork skills
* ... rely heavily on others to provide you with tasks and instructions, rather than taking initiative
* ... expect detailed and precise plans for every task you undertake, hindering your ability to adapt and innovate
* ... are not proactive and lack the motivation to go above and beyond what is required
* ... are hesitant to explore new technologies and step outside of your comfort zone, limiting your growth and potential
* ... struggle to take ownership of your tasks and responsibilities, often relying on others to complete them for you

**Our values**  

https://careers.digistore24.com/en/culture-and-core-values


Please take a REALLY close look at the values. Are you ready to live them?

title: Dot Net Developer
description:
**Company Description**  

We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!  

  

We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.  

  

With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.


We are looking for you who want to grow with us!  

  

With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.

 **Job Description**  

We are seeking a highly skilled **Senior .NET & Azure Developer** to join our team. The ideal candidate will have strong hands-on experience in **.NET Core, Microservices, and APIs**, combined with deep knowledge of **Azure Cloud Services** and **modern CI/CD practices**. This role will involve developing cloud-native solutions, building integrations, and driving technical improvements.

**Key Responsibilities**

* Design, develop, and maintain applications using **.NET Core, Microservices, and APIs**.
* Implement and optimize **cloud-native integrations** on Azure.
* Work with **Azure Functions, Logic Apps, Service Bus, App Service, App Insights, Blob Storage, Azure Monitoring, and Cosmos DB**.
* Build and maintain **CI/CD pipelines** using Azure DevOps and GitHub Actions.
* Implement **Infrastructure as Code (IaC)** with **Terraform** and **Bicep**.
* Work with **messaging frameworks and event brokers** (e.g., **Solace PubSub, Kafka**).
* Ensure application and cloud security best practices are followed.
* Prepare high-quality **technical artifacts** and documentation.
* Identify and propose **technical improvements** for systems and processes.

 **Qualifications** **Requirements**

* **5+ years** of hands-on experience in application development and system integration.
* Strong expertise in **.NET Core, Microservices, and APIs**.
* Proven experience with **Azure Cloud Services** (Functions, Logic Apps, Service Bus, App Service, App Insights, Blob Storage, Monitoring, Cosmos DB).
* Hands-on experience with **CI/CD pipelines** (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions).
* Strong knowledge of **Terraform and/or Bicep** for IaC.
* Experience with **messaging/event frameworks** (Kafka, Solace PubSub).
* Solid understanding of **cloud-native integration patterns**.
* Good knowledge of **application and cloud security best practices**.
* Strong problem-solving, documentation, and communication skills.

 **Nice to Have**

* Exposure to other event brokers or messaging systems.
* Familiarity with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Prior experience in designing large-scale distributed systems.

 **Additional Information** **Start:** Immediate

**Form of employment:** Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.

**We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.**

title: Systemutvecklare med stort intresse för verksamhet
description:
Har du en bred IT kompetens och ett stort intresse av att lära dig verksamheten samt vill bidra till samhällsnyttan? Vi erbjuder dig en unik möjlighet att få kombinera systemutveckling med verksamhetskunskap där vi sätter stort fokus på din personlighet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att utveckla dig och dina kompetenser tillsammans med motiverade och erfarna kollegor. Vi arbetar med moderna tekniker och verktyg vilket möjliggörs av Skatteverkets ambition att vara i framkant och arbeta utforskande kring såväl arbetssätt som teknik. Var med och gör samhället bättre!

 **Om jobbet**  

  

Du arbetar med systemutveckling i ett agilt team där ni tillsammans ansvarar för både nyutveckling och vidareutveckling av våra långsiktiga och hållbara tjänster. Hos oss jobbar du med problemlösning och skriver tillsammans med teamet kod som har betydelse för hela samhället. Du har frihet och eget ansvar att bidra till nya lösningar. Ditt team har förutsättningar att ta ett helhetsansvar för både lösning och dess underhåll. Du är utvecklare, men bidrar också inom andra områden som analys, kravställning och testning. Du arbetar både självständigt och tillsammans med teamet och ni hjälper varandra på ett prestigelöst sätt. Du får möjlighet till varierande arbetsuppgifter med moderna utvecklingsmiljöer och plattformar. Du kommer att samarbeta med andra utvecklingsteam, verksamhetsexperter och andra myndigheter.


Vi är en stor it-avdelning i Umeå med cirka 160 medarbetare som ger dig god möjlighet till att utvecklas. För att du ska ha en bra balans mellan arbete och fritid erbjuder vi flexibel arbetstid med möjlighet att kombinera distansarbete med arbete på kontoret. Skatteverket har bra friskvårdsförmåner och erbjuder fler semesterdagar än genomsnittet.


Numera återfinns vi i våra nybyggda lokaler vid Östra station i Umeå.


Skatteverkets it-avdelning arbetar aktivt för att främja en inkluderande arbetsplats som präglas av jämställdhet och mångfald där alla medarbetare får lika möjligheter att bidra och utvecklas.
  

Läs mer på Jobba med it hos oss

 **Om dig**


För att göra ett bra jobb och trivas hos oss på Skatteverket behöver du vara lyhörd, tänka nytt och ta ansvar. Du ska också leva upp till vår medarbetarpolicy.


I det här jobbet ska du:


vara resultatinriktad och se till både gruppens och din egen prestation kunna analysera informationsflöden, se samband, mönster och göra avgränsningar agera medvetet och professionellt utifrån en god självinsikt ha god samarbetsförmåga, vara hjälpsam och ha ett gott bemötande ha förmågan och viljan att lära dig nya saker, vara flexibel och kunna ställa om vid förändringar kunna kommunicera på svenska i tal och skrift.


 Du ska även ha:

* minst 60p/90hp eftergymnasial utbildning inom IT


 Det är önskvärt om du har:

* tidigare erfarenhet av verksamhetsutveckling i någon form

 **Bra att veta**


Anställningen är tillsvidare och kan inledas med provanställning i sex månader.


En anställning hos oss kan innebära placering i säkerhetsklass. En säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) kan därför komma att genomföras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap.


I det här jobbet finns det på grund av arbetsuppgifternas karaktär inte möjlighet att arbeta hemifrån.


På skatteverket.se/jobb kan du exempelvis läsa om vår samhällsbärande roll, fördelarna med att jobba hos oss och hur det går till när du söker våra jobb.


När du ansöker bifogar du ditt cv. Vi använder inte personligt brev i våra rekryteringar och du ska därför inte bifoga det i din ansökan.


Välkommen med din ansökan!


Skatteverket har en samhällsbärande roll. Vårt arbete berör alla privatpersoner och företag och genom vårt uppdrag bidrar vi till ett väl fungerande samhälle. Vår utveckling är kunddriven och vi samverkar med andra för att skapa effektiva lösningar. Tillsammans gör vi samhället möjligt.


Anställningsform: tillsvidareanställning | Anställningens omfattning: heltid | Antal lediga befattningar: 1 | Sysselsättningsgrad: 100% | Ort: Umeå | Län: Västerbottens län | Land: Sweden | Referensnummer: 2025/692 | Kontakt: Olov Lindfors, sektionschef olov.lindfors@skatteverket.se, Stella Merkle, hr-specialist stella.merkle@skatteverket.se, | Facklig företrädare: Jeanette Forsgren, ST jeanette.forsgren@skatteverket.se, Göran Sundwall, Saco goran.sundwall@skatteverket.se, | Publicerat: 2025-09-01 | Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-09-22

title: .NET Backend-utvecklare i Borås
description:
Vill du vara en del av ett framstående team som driver digital transformation för ICA Sveriges marknadsavdelning och ICA Reklam? Vi söker .NET Backend-utvecklare som vill utveckla innovativa IT-lösningar för marknadsföring, kundlojalitet och e-handel. Tillsammans med vårt dedikerade team kommer du att bidra till utvecklingen av robusta och skalbara backend-lösningar för att hantera dagens och morgondagens digitala behov.

**Jobbet som Backend utvecklare**  

Som backend-utvecklare ansvarar du för att leverera kod av hög kvalitet på ett effektivt sätt. Du ingår ett team som utvecklar lösningar för att möta våra användares behov, handlare, kundtjänst och slutkonsumenter. Stort fokus ligger på att etablera nya lösningar som stöttar både befintlig affär och de nya digitala kanalerna men även på stabilitet i befintliga lösningar. Vi tillämpar objektorienterad analys och design och du kommer att ha möjlighet att arbeta med enhetstester och säkerställa kvalitet i kodleveransen.

**Är du den vi söker?**  

Vi söker dig med några års erfarenhet inom .NET (C#) och goda kunskaper inom SQL. Önskvärt är erfarenhet av arbete med dokumentdatabaser såsom Cosmos Db eller MongoDb samt meddelandehanterare som Kafka och Azure ServiceBus. Erfarenhet av RESTful API i C# och TDD/enhetstestning är meriterande.

  

Vi letar efter en lagspelare som trivs i en självorganiserad miljö och som är engagerad i att leverera värde för verksamheten. Du bör vara kommunikativ och ha förmågan att samarbeta effektivt med andra team.  

  

Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska krävs.  

  

**Vad händer nu?**  

Om du har frågor tjänsten är du välkommen att kontakta Anders Lornell, Manager Engineering Foundation, på 0707-773 301 Urval.  

  

Vi gör löpande urval så skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock ej senare än 10:e oktober.  

  

ICA ska spegla våra kunder och samhället, vi strävar därför efter att anställa människor med olika bakgrund, kompetenser, kunskap och erfarenheter. Tester kan förekomma i processen. Vi värnar om goda arbetsmiljöförhållanden med mål om helt rökfria arbetsplatser och tillämpar även drogtestning i samband med rekryteringen.

  

Läs mer om hur det är att jobba på ICA, https://karriar.icagruppen.se/se/sv/livet-pa-ica

title: Game developer
description:
We are now looking for the best game developer to join us! You have the chance to be a part of creating the best casino games in the online slot industry!
   

  

**Job Description**
* Design, develop and maintain Casino Games for both desktop and mobile browsers
* The technologies you primarily will work with are HTML5, WebGL, Typescript, Pixi, GSAP and Javascript.
* In a team environment that consists of product management, graphic artistry, sound creation, server development and game mechanics, you will contribute to deliver the best casino games in the market today.
* Your main responsibilities are to make the game graphics come alive with spectacular animations, game flow, game mechanics and sounds according to a result delivered by our game servers.


 Who you are
   

  

* You are a Master Google Searcher that have Stackoverflow as your absolute favourite web site.
* You have practical experience of working with OOP in some language and you have a pragmatic approach to software development.
* Taking on technical challenges and solving them is something you take pride in.
* Quality, not only of the code you write, but the delivered system is important to you.
* You thrive in an environment where you are responsible for your code and take ownership of changes from editor to production system.


 Beneficial skills
   

  

* Working experience of mobile browsers and knowledge about their limitations and how they work in different ways is a big plus.


 Who we are
   

  

 We are the best and fastest growing slot provider in the world with the operator and product in focus, and the mobile future on our minds. Nolimit is a team of experienced professionals from the gambling industry in Stockholm, Sweden, Malta and Gurugram, India. Our company has derived from hands on work at some of the most successful gambling software providers and operators over the last 15 years. Our mission is to offer a fast, reliable and flexible team that cooperates with the best operators in the world, taking gambling to the next level.
   

  

 We have a clean code high performance modern mini/micro service portable system platform for mobile and desktop that is 100 % under our own control. Since we have our own platform, this allows us to deliver special features and smooth, customizable marketing campaigns that are tailored to the operator's specific needs. We think it's time for a new angle to the gambling software industry – one where the product is in focus and we fully engage their promotion, marketing and country manager system/activities with our games. Nolimit work with customers on a global scale and the largest gambling operators in the world have our games everywhere.
   

  

 Nolimit City, Stockholm based development team. We provide you with your choice of OS and IDE.
   

  

 Send your application to hr-sweden@nolimitcity.com
   

  

 http://www.nolimitcity.com

title: Dot Net Developer
description:
**Company Description**
 We are a consulting company with a bunch of technology-interested and happy people!
   

  

 We love technology, we love design and we love quality. Our diversity makes us unique and creates an inclusive and welcoming workplace where each individual is highly valued.
   

  

 With us, each individual is her/himself and respects others for who they are and we believe that when a fantastic mix of people gather and share their knowledge, experiences and ideas, we can help our customers on a completely different level.
   

  

 We are looking for you who want to grow with us!
   

  

 With us, you have great opportunities to take real steps in your career and the opportunity to take great responsibility.
   

  

**Job Description**
 We are seeking a highly skilled
 **Senior .NET & Azure Developer** 
 to join our team. The ideal candidate will have strong hands-on experience in
 **.NET Core, Microservices, and APIs** 
 , combined with deep knowledge of
 **Azure Cloud Services** 
 and
 **modern CI/CD practices** 
 . This role will involve developing cloud-native solutions, building integrations, and driving technical improvements.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Design, develop, and maintain applications using .NET Core, Microservices, and APIs.
* Implement and optimize cloud-native integrations on Azure.
* Work with Azure Functions, Logic Apps, Service Bus, App Service, App Insights, Blob Storage, Azure Monitoring, and Cosmos DB.
* Build and maintain CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps and GitHub Actions.
* Implement Infrastructure as Code (IaC) with Terraform and Bicep.
* Work with messaging frameworks and event brokers (e.g., Solace PubSub, Kafka).
* Ensure application and cloud security best practices are followed.
* Prepare high-quality technical artifacts and documentation.
* Identify and propose technical improvements for systems and processes.


 Qualifications
   

  

**Requirements**
* 5+ years of hands-on experience in application development and system integration.
* Strong expertise in .NET Core, Microservices, and APIs.
* Proven experience with Azure Cloud Services (Functions, Logic Apps, Service Bus, App Service, App Insights, Blob Storage, Monitoring, Cosmos DB).
* Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines (Azure DevOps, GitHub Actions).
* Strong knowledge of Terraform and/or Bicep for IaC.
* Experience with messaging/event frameworks (Kafka, Solace PubSub).
* Solid understanding of cloud-native integration patterns.
* Good knowledge of application and cloud security best practices.
* Strong problem-solving, documentation, and communication skills.


**Nice to Have**
* Exposure to other event brokers or messaging systems.
* Familiarity with containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Prior experience in designing large-scale distributed systems.


 Additional Information
   

  

**Start:** 
 Immediate
   

  

**Form of employment:** 
 Full-time until further notice, we apply 6 months probationary employment.
   

  

**We interview candidates on an ongoing basis, do not wait to submit your application.**

title: Front-end Developer
description:
**Front-end (Angular) developers** 




**Stockholm in Sweden or Vilnius in Lithuania** 




  









 Digital Lending consists of several cross-functional agile teams that design, build and maintain Lending products in digital customer channels (internet bank, mobile bank) for bank customers in Sweden.
 



 Digital Lending will augment the current teams with 8 new FTCs in different roles. To have the right balance between different roles and competencies we need 2 Front-end developers.
 



 Location can be either Stockholm in Sweden or Vilnius in Lithuania. 3 days per week is expected that consultant will work from our office.
 







 Main responsibilities:
 



 Design, develop, deploy & maintain Lending products in Internet Bank
 



 Work on front-end features in Internet bank using Angular framework
 



 Closely collaborate with UX designers and influence design decisions
 



 Continuously improve the quality of our products by proactively reducing technical depth and writing unit tests
 







 Requirements:
 



 A relevant academic degree or equivalent work experience within IT
 



 5+ years of experience with Angular framework (v16 or higher)
 



 Experience in Java or mobile application development is considered as an advantage
 



 A drive to write clean, testable, and maintainable code
 



 Experience in agile way of working (preferable Scrum, SAFe frameworks)
 



 Fluency in English and good communication skills
 



 Technology stack we use:
 



 Front-end: Angular, Typescript, NgRx, RxJS, NX, ES6, Jest, Playwright
 



 Back-end: Java, REST, Spring Boot, JUnit
 



 Mobile Apps: Kotlin, Swift
 



 Dev. environment: GitHub, GitHub Actions, OpenShift, Kubernetes, Gradle, any of - Eclipse, WebStorm, IntelliJ, VS Code, Android Studio, Xcode
 



 Digital Customer Experience Analytics: Adobe Analytics, SiteSpect, Glassbox
 



 Other: Jira, Confluence (wiki), Figma, MS Teams

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Senior Software Engineer** 




 TL;DR - We want a data-obsessed engineer to build the backbone of AI-powered sales intelligence. You'll architect the data infrastructure that powers personalized coaching for sales teams worldwide, turning complex datasets into game-changing insights that reshape how millions communicate and sell.
 



  





**Ready to Build the Future of Sales Communication?** 




 Join Agaton - where advanced AI transforms sales performance! We're not just building another data platform; we're creating the intelligence layer that transforms how sales professionals learn, grow, and succeed across the globe.
 



  





**About Agaton** 




 At Agaton, we're building the future of customer interactions through a revolutionary approach, that combines: empowering human agents with AI-powered coaching that dramatically increases performance, while deploying autonomous AI voice agents that handle customer interactions with the sophistication and nuance of top-performing professionals.
 



  





 Our autonomous agents don't just follow scripts - they understand context, adapt to customer needs in real-time, and deliver personalized experiences that feel genuinely human. They can handle complex customer interactions, understand objections, and build relationships while maintaining the highest standards of professionalism and authenticity.
 



  





 We're not just improving customer interactions - we're fundamentally changing it for the better. Sales shouldn't be pushy; it should be intelligent, helpful, and genuinely valuable. Our mission is to make world-class communication accessible to everyone, whether that's through coaching human agents or through our autonomous AI agents that represent the gold standard in customer interactions.
 



  





 We're a high-growth, talent-dense team of machine learning engineers, software developers, and designers based in Stockholm, expanding rapidly into new markets globally. Backed by some of the best angel investors in the world, our team brings experience from industry champions like Tink, Spotify, Shopify, Zettle by PayPal, Sana, and EF.
 



  





 We're working on something that will be absolutely huge - a new category leader in AI that's solving an age-old, trillion-dollar problem for businesses globally. This is your chance to be part of something generation-defining.
 



  





**The Opportunity** 




 As our Senior Software Engineer, you'll be the architect behind the data infrastructure that powers millions of personalized coaching interactions. You'll work cross-functionally to build scalable systems that turn raw conversation data into actionable insights, enabling our AI to deliver precise, impactful coaching that transforms careers and businesses worldwide.
 



  





**What You'll Be Doing 🚀** 



* Design and build robust, scalable data pipelines that process millions of sales interactions daily
* Lead the architecture and implementation of complex software solutions, ensuring best practices in code quality, testing, and performance.
* Architect data infrastructure from ingestion to insights, ensuring reliability, performance, and security at scale
* Develop and optimize data models, warehouses, and real-time processing systems that power our AI coaching engine
* Collaborate closely with ML engineers, product teams, and stakeholders to translate business needs into data solutions
* Ensure data quality through comprehensive validation, monitoring, and governance frameworks
* Build analytics capabilities that empower teams across the organization to make data-driven decisions
* Optimize cloud infrastructure leveraging AWS and GCP services for maximum efficiency and scalability
* Drive innovation by staying current with emerging technologies and proposing solutions that enhance our platform



  





**What We're Looking For 🤩** 




 Essential:
 


* Proven experience as a Senior Software Engineer with a strong background in full stack development.
* Proficiency in Python, with a solid understanding of software design patterns and best practices.
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms, particularly AWS and GCP, including deploying and managing applications.
* Strong problem-solving skills, with the ability to tackle complex technical challenges and deliver effective solutions.
* Familiarity with modern frontend frameworks and technologies (React, Next.js, etc.) is a plus.
* Experience leading engineering teams or mentoring junior developers is highly desirable.
* Excellent communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* A proactive, self-driven mindset with a passion for continuous learning and improvement.
* Bonus: Experience in AI, machine learning, or data-driven products.



 Bonus Points:
 


* Experience in AI/ML data pipelines and model serving infrastructure
* Background in conversation analytics or communication data
* Startup or founding experience, especially building data platforms from zero to scale
* Experience with real-time streaming and event-driven architectures
* Strong opinions about the best data platform tools and frameworks



  





**What We Offer 👀** 



* Competitive salary & equity package - be part of building something meaningful and different
* Six weeks annual paid vacation - we believe in work-life balance
* Wellness budget - invest in your health and wellbeing
* Learning & development budget - continuous growth and skill development
* Stockholm-based role with flexibility and modern office environment
* Unprecedented impact opportunity - help reshape how the world communicates and sells



  





**Ready to Build the Future?** 




 We're looking for someone who cares deeply about data quality, ships fast, and is eager to make a dent in the world. If you're excited about building data infrastructure that powers AI-driven sales transformation, we want to hear from you.
 



  





 This is more than a job - it's your chance to be part of a generation-defining company that's transforming how businesses communicate and grow. Join us in building something extraordinary.
 



  





**Apply now and help us engineer the future of sales intelligence.** 




  





 This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden. Please submit your application in English - it's our company language and you'll be using it daily if you join our team.
 



  





*Learn more about us at www.agaton.ai*

title: Software Engineer - Early Careers
description:
**About The Role**
**Important note:** 
 Please remember to include your grade transcript along with your CV when submitting your application.
   

  

****The team** 
 :** 
 Our team consists of 8-10 engineers and is responsible for a web-based application for delivery of optimization services for large financial institutions. We value working with passionate, talented and nice people who have fun together, while pushing ourselves and our systems to improve continuously. Our architecture is clean and modern and based upon patterns like automated testing, modulation, clear boundaries and clear responsibilities, and we believe in continuous and iterative delivery, fail fast, prototyping and continuous feedback from internal and external clients.
   

  

**The tech** 
 : Our services run on a modern stack based on Python, Kotlin and TypeScript with React. We run our services in a cloud environment using Docker, Kubernetes and associated technologies.
   

  

**The impact** 
 : OSTTRA has the largest financial institutions in the world as clients, and our optimization businesses the largest banks in the world specifically. Our optimization services deliver significant impacts to clients portfolio compositions and operational costs, and when we run our services, global metrics of systemic risks in the financial markets move to a high degree. We believe that long-term value to the client is the most important goal of our team, and technology is the tool to bring that value, and your contribution in the form of delivery, improvements and innovations can have a significant impact on the financial system.
   

  

**What’s in it for you** 
 : We strongly believe in individual growth and have long experience in guiding early careers engineers in our modern approach to software production, which includes:
   

  

* Rapid, iterative and phased delivery, backed by automated testing and deployment frameworks
* Streamlined, autonomous and independent teams, optimised and supported for fast change
* Clean architecture for maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with the team structures and with clear boundaries and responsibilities
* Innovative culture with strong focus on exploration and prototyping, where failing fast is a virtue which drives technological and product improvements.


 We’ve worked with many students and hired several who joined originally during their studies - so this could be the place you activate your career.
   

  

**Early Career Software Engineer Position Profile**
 We are seeking a newly graduated student to join our innovative and forward-thinking team as a Software Engineer. Our company is at the forefront of rapid, iterative, and phased delivery, backed by cutting-edge automated testing and deployment frameworks. We believe in streamlined, autonomous, and independent teams that are optimised and supported for swift adaptability. Our commitment to clean architecture ensures maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with team structures and defined responsibilities.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As a Software Engineer, you will contribute to the success of our projects with a
   

  

 focus on talent, passion, and grit. While no prior work experience is required, we are looking for candidates who hold a Master's degree in Computer Science. We foster an innovative culture that places a strong emphasis on exploration and prototyping. Here, failing fast is seen as a virtue, propelling technological and product improvements.
   

  

* Collaborate with cross-functional, autonomous teams for rapid and phased delivery
* Uphold clean architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability, and flexibility
* Contribute to an innovative culture through exploration, prototyping, and a willingness to take calculated risks
* Engage in continuous learning to stay abreast of the latest technologies and industry best practices


**Basic Qualifications**
**What We're Looking For** 
 :
   

  

* Master's degree in Computer Science
* 0-2 years of relevant experience.
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for learning
* Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative environment
* Excellent communication skills and the ability to contribute ideas to a diverse team


 If you are a tech enthusiast with a thirst for innovation and a desire to contribute to an exciting and fast-paced environment, we invite you to apply for this position. Join us as we redefine the boundaries of technology and drive impactful change in the industry.
   

  

**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Recruitment Fraud Alert**
 If you receive an email from a spglobalind.com domain or any other regionally based domains, it is a scam and should be reported to reportfraud@spglobal.com. S&P Global never requires any candidate to pay money for job applications, interviews, offer letters, “pre-employment training” or for equipment/delivery of equipment. Stay informed and protect yourself from recruitment fraud by reviewing our guidelines, fraudulent domains, and how to report suspicious activity here.
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law. Pay Transparency Nondiscrimination Provision - https://www.dol.gov/sites/dolgov/files/ofccp/pdf/pay-transp\_%20English\_formattedESQA508c.pdf

 2025-09-01

 Stockholm, Sweden

title: Software Engineer
description:
**Why join us?**
 We’re on a mission to empower people with disabilities to do what they once did or never thought possible. As the world-leader in assistive communication solutions, we empower our customers to express themselves, connect with the world, and live richer lives.
   

  

 At Tobii Dynavox, you can grow your career within a dynamic, global company that has a clear, impactful purpose - with the flexibility to also do what truly matters to you outside of work. What’s more, you’ll be part of a work culture where collaboration is the norm and individuality is welcomed.
   

  

 As a member of our team, you’ll have the power to innovate for good. You’ll see your ideas in use in new applications, work with the latest technology on leading platforms, and deliver meaningful solutions for our customers.
   

  

 We’re at an exciting stage in our journey—growing rapidly and expanding our Product & Development team in Stockholm to build a vibrant hub for innovation, product design, and technology. This is a unique opportunity to join a thriving organization where you can help shape the future of assistive communication, defining how we work and delivering impactful solutions for our users.
   

  

 We are building a culture of empowered, collaborative teams who are passionate about helping individuals with disabilities find their voice and connect with the world. Our teams thrive on trust, collaboration, and a positive environment where everyone lead and contributes. We deeply understand the people we serve, empathize with their challenges, and use our expertise to make a real difference.
   

  

**About the Role:**
 As a Software Engineer, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and improving a widely used Windows-based application that serves thousands of users. This role involves enhancing existing features, resolving technical issues, optimizing performance, and contributing to the long-term sustainability of the software.
   

  

 The ideal candidate is passionate about Windows desktop application development and is eager to explore modern technologies that can enhance the platform. You will work closely with senior engineers and cross-functional teams to address bug reports, improve build and deployment processes, and ensure high-quality software development through best coding practices. A strong commitment to quality, problem-solving, and continuous improvement is essential. A proactive mindset, strong problem-solving skills, and a drive for innovation are essential to success in this role.
   

  

 In this role, you will:
   

  

* Maintain and Improve Existing Software – Develop, refine, and enhance the current software to ensure performance, scalability, and long-term maintainability.
* Identify and Resolve Issues – Debug, troubleshoot, and fix software defects while optimizing code for better efficiency and user experience.
* Enhance Build and Deployment Processes – Contribute to improving the build, deployment, and release workflows to streamline software delivery.
* Collaborate with Cross-Functional Teams – Work closely with product managers, QA engineers, and other developers to address bug reports, implement improvements, and refine features.
* Ensure Code Quality and Best Practices – Follow internal coding standards, participate in code reviews, and maintain documentation to support high-quality development.
* Provide Ongoing Technical Support – Assist in troubleshooting and resolving production issues to maintain software reliability and minimize downtime.
* Proactively Innovate and Solve Problems – Take initiative in identifying areas for improvement, proposing innovative solutions, and contributing to the overall success of the software.


**What We're Looking For:**
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, related technical field, or equivalent practical experience required
* 2-5 years of development experience in C# and experience in C++
* Strong background in software development, especially on Windows desktop applications
* Experience in Azure DevOps
* Experience in developing large desktop applications
* Ability to focus on delivering customer value, while optimizing architecture
* Experience in modernizing legacy desktop application
* Experience in Scrum or other Agile processes
* Familiarity / interest in automated testing paradigms, especially desktop applications.
* Ability to collaborate with different stakeholders


 Apply today!
   

  

 We believe in empowering individuals - including our own employees - to reach their full potential. So, if you want to change lives while growing your own career, we’d love to hear from you.

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**About Us:** 




  





 Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs. Leveraging our holistic portfolio of capabilities in consulting, design, engineering, and operations, we help clients realize their boldest ambitions and build future-ready, sustainable businesses. With over 230,000 employees and business partners across 65 countries, we deliver on the promise of helping our clients, colleagues, and communities thrive in an ever-changing world.
 



  





**About the Role:** 




  





 We are looking for a passionate Full stack Agile Software Engineer who thrives on building innovative web solutions that make a difference. You will be part of an agile DevOps and collaborative team where diverse perspectives are valued, and continuous learning is encouraged. This role offers the opportunity to grow your technical skills while contributing to a supportive and inclusive work environment.
 



  





 You will collaborate closely with colleagues, product owners, and domain experts. Strong communication skills and the ability to work autonomously are essential – you should be comfortable driving initiatives forward independently, while also fostering effective collaboration in a team setting.
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 




  




* Design and develop modern applications with requirements on availability and reliability.
* Create robust integration layers to connect internal systems and external actors.
* Build automation features that simplify and streamline time-critical processes.
* Take lead on architectural decisions, ensuring solutions are secure, maintainable, and future-proof. Implement and advocate for unit testing and high-quality development practices.
* Contribute to and spread modern DevOps methodologies, enabling continuous delivery of resilient features.



  





**Required Qualifications:** 




  




* Minimum
 **5 years** 
 of experience with
 **.NET Core, C#, Angular, TypeScript, Azure, Azure DevOps, Git** 
 , and
 **CI/CD pipelines** 
 .
* **1 - 2 years** 
 of hands-on experience with
 **Tailwind CSS** 
 .
* Strong understanding of
 **messaging and asynchronous systems** 
 including
 **Kafka** 
 ,
 **Azure Service Bus** 
 , and real-time communication.
* Deep expertise in
 **API and system integration** 
 ,
 **asynchronous communication** 
 ,
 **automation** 
 , and
 **unit testing** 
 (xUnit, NUnit, etc.).
* Excellent communication skills and proven ability to work independently in complex projects.
* Background in
 **energy or finance sectors** 
 , where
 **availability, reliability, and security** 
 are critical.



  





  





**Diversity and Inclusion at Wipro** 




  





*We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, marital status, age, ethnic and national origin, sexual and political orientation and disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.* 




  





 Reinvent your world. We are building a modern Wipro. We are an end-to-end digital transformation partner with the boldest ambitions. To realize them, we need people inspired by reinvention. Of yourself, your career, and your skills. We want to see the constant evolution of our business and our industry. It has always been in our DNA - as the world around us changes, so do we. Join a business powered by purpose and a place that empowers you to design your own reinvention. Come to Wipro. Realize your ambitions. Applications from people with disabilities are explicitly welcome.

title: Application Developer
description:

 Wipro Limited (NYSE: WIT, BSE: 507685, NSE: WIPRO) is a leading technology services and consulting company focused on building innovative solutions that address clients’ most complex digital transformation needs.  We're looking for a passionate Fullstack Developer who thrives on building innovative web solutions that make a difference. **Nice to Have:**

Join a business powered by purpose and a place that empowers you to design your own reinvention. Come to Wipro. Realize your ambitions. title: Software Engineer
description:
**The Opportunity in a Nutshell**
 Are you a skilled developer who thrives in a collaborative team environment? At
 **Vend Mobility,** 
 our tight-knit, diverse team is redefining mobility services across the Nordics. We’re looking for a Software Engineer to help shape the future of price packaging for our Mobility offerings, impacting millions of users across our Marketplace brands. As part of our team, you’ll work on a cutting-edge event-driven platform to build innovative solutions that meet the dynamic marketplace demands.
   

  

**Our Tech Stack** 
 💻
   

  

 At
 **Vend** 
 we are transitioning the local brands, such as Blocket, DBA, and FINN, to the common Nordic tech stack called Aurora. As such, our team is moving from the current tech stack with backend services built in Golang and Python to a
 **Java/Kotlin-** 
 based architecture running on
 **Google Cloud** 
 . On the frontend, we leverage
 **React, TypeScript, and Next.js** 
 . CI/CD pipelines via GitHub Actions ensure seamless deployments, while Datadog, Kibana/Grafana, and Amplitude support robust data analysis and logging.
   

  

**Responsibilities** 
 🤓
   

  

 The Coming Year Will Be Pivotal As We Balance The Transition Of Blocket’s Platform To Aurora With The Ongoing Evolution Of Mobility Services. This Dual Responsibility Requires Maintaining a Seamless User Experience While Introducing Innovative Pricing Solutions For Private Sellers. As a Software Engineer In Our Mobility Team, You’ll
   

  

* Build scalable backend services and enhance frontend experiences that directly impact millions of users
* Collaborate with a cross-functional team of developers, designers, product managers, and analysts to create intuitive pricing models and packaging solutions
* Be part of strategic discussions, using your insights to align technical solutions with user needs and business goals


**Who You Are**
 You’re a proactive, responsible developer with a knack for teamwork and a passion for sharing knowledge. You take pride in solving problems with precision and enjoy having a full-scope role where the team collectively owns the development process.
   

  

**Additionally, You Have**
* Approximately 5+ years of experience
* Strong skills in Java/Kotlin and solid knowledge of React and TypeScript
* A collaborative mindset, and you thrive on the exchange of knowledge and experiences with your colleagues
* The drive and initiative to take the lead in teamwork
* Curiosity and openness to experiment with data and AI to solve real-world problems


**Opportunities** 
 🚀
   

  

**You’ll Have Opportunities To**
* Shape and build the new Price Engine for optimising user experience and sustainable revenue growth through experimenting with price packages and new services
* Drive the future opportunities through optimizing ownership lifecycle management in the Seller journey, and scale that to all Nordic Mobility countries
* Design scalable features that maximize value for users
* Collaborate with Nordic marketplace teams to deliver harmonized solutions tailored to regional needs
* Innovate within a user-first environment, tackling challenges that redefine the mobility space


**Why Join Us?**
* Mission-driven impact: Help empower users to make smarter, data-driven decisions in the mobility market
* Collaboration: Be part of a diverse Nordic company, supporting and connecting users across the Nordic countries
* Work–life balance: Enjoy a hybrid setup with 2–3 days per week in our central and modern Stockholm office, flexible hours, and family-friendly policies
* Culture of growth: Take advantage of a dedicated monthly learning day, tech talks, internal skill-up courses, and knowledge-sharing sessions


*Want to get a feel for our culture and what drives us?*
 👉 Take a peek behind the scenes at our Career Page!
   

  

**Interested?** 
 😀
   

  

 If this role and environment have caught your interest, we look forward to learning more about you soon! We eagerly await your application and look forward to hearing about your skills and career goals. We value diversity and encourage applicants from all backgrounds to apply.
   

  

 You are welcome to get in touch with us if you have questions regarding the positions. Hiring Manager,
 **Jeanette Nilsson, Engineering Manager** 
 (jeanette.nilsson(at)vend.com)

title: Senior Dotnet Developer
description:

title: Java Backend Engineer
description:

title: Senior Software Engineer
description:
**Senior .NET Opportunity in Central Stockholm** 




  





 I am hiring for a Swedish speaking Senior .NET Developer role in central Stockholm for a Nordic software company.
 



  





 As a well known Nordic organisation, they are passionate about Microsoft development and ensuring their employees are highly skilled. You'll join a talented team delivering innovative and high-impact solutions for customers within sectors such as health-tech, public services, green energy, etc., and contribute to critical digital transformation projects in a dynamic and fast-paced environment.
 



  





 You'll use cutting-edge technologies to design systems that make a meaningful difference. If you're feeling you've hit a wall in your current position and want a new challenge, this is your chance to work on diverse, impactful products and progress within your career.
 



  





**Requirements:** 




  




* 8-13 years .NET experience
* Experience with front end technologies (JavaScript, React, or Angular)
* Experience with Azure and Microservices.



  





*This role requires candidates to speak fluent Swedish. You can be based in Stockholm, Gothenburg, or Malmo.* 




  





 Salary dependent on experience, hybrid working, insurances, wellness allowance, collective agreement.
 



  





**This is just a brief description of the role and company. For more information, please apply and I will be in touch.**

title: Software Developer
description:
**Utveckla framtiden med oss** 




 Omegapoint är ett konsultföretag som skapar framtidens digitala tjänster. Vi fortsätter att växa och letar nu efter dig som har några års erfarenhet av systemutveckling.
 



  





**Brinner du för säkerhet inom systemutveckling?** 




 I denna roll blir du en viktig spelare i vårt team och vi tror därför att du är en teamplayer med högt ansvarstagande och kvalitétstänk. Du trivs i kundrelationerna där du är en både strukturerad och engagerad rådgivare och har förmåga att omsätta dina kunskaper i konkreta lösningar. Du är van att agera självständigt och inte rädd för att ta egna initiativ. Som person tror vi vidare att du är öppen, positiv och trivs i en organisation präglad av kompetensutveckling där vi är vassa och snälla mot varandra.
 



 Att du vill dela med dig av din kompetens till dina kollegor genom exempelvis mentorskap eller att delta på våra interna kompetensdagar tycker vi är en självklarhet. Vi bygger och stärker vår fina kompetenskultur tillsammans!
 



  





**För den här tjänsten tror vi även att du:** 



* har minst tre års erfarenhet av programmering i Java, C#/.NET eller liknande
* arbetar kvalitetsinriktat och känner dig bekväm med såväl testdriven utveckling som automatiserade tester
* har kunskap kring IaC, pipelines och traditionell DevOps/DevSecOps
* eventuellt har erfarenhet av domändriven design
* har arbetat med agila utvecklingsmetoder
* har en akademisk examen eller motsvarande
* behärskar svenska i tal och skrift



  





**Om oss** 




 Omegapoint grundades 2001 och är Norra Europas ledande konsultbolag inom cybersäker digitalisering. Med en vision om en framtid där vi fullt ut kan lita på teknik använder vi vår expertis för att säkra våra kunders och medarbetares utveckling. Vi är vassa och snälla, något som karaktäriseras av vår kompetensutvecklingskultur och viljan att dela vår kunskap med varandra. För närvarande är vi över 900 anställda konsulter i Stockholm, Oslo, Drammen, Köpenhamn, Göteborg, Malmö, Örebro, Västerås, Enköping, Uppsala och Umeå.
 



  





**Vi satsar på dig** 




 På Omegapoint sätter vi din kompetens i centrum och ger dig alla förutsättningar för ett utvecklande och varierat jobb. Som konsult hos oss tillbringar du vardagen i uppdrag hos någon av våra kunder, men har alltid en välkomnande hemmahamn på kontoret i centrala Stockholm. Här ordnar vi mängder av aktiviteter under året för att vi ska utvecklas och ligga i framkant. Det är en del i vår kompetenskultur som bygger på samarbete och en vilja att stärka varandra.
 



  





 Med en stor och varierande kundbas, från små specialistföretag till stora och välkända företag och myndigheter, har vi en möjlighet att erbjuda utmanande och roliga uppdrag.
 



  





 Givetvis erbjuder vi även allt det andra som är viktigt, som marknadsmässiga löner, förstärkt föräldralön, anpassade förmånspaket, friskvårdsbidrag, sjukvårdsförsäkring och möjlighet till delägarskap.
 



  





 Vi vågar lova dig en arbetsplats där du kommer att trivas, utvecklas och ges alla möjligheter till en ljus framtid.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Full Stack)
company_industry: Financial Services, IT Services and IT Consulting, and Technology, Information and Internet
description:
**Our Purpose**
*Mastercard powers economies and empowers people in 200+ countries and territories worldwide. Together with our customers, we’re helping build a sustainable economy where everyone can prosper. We support a wide range of digital payments choices, making transactions secure, simple, smart and accessible. Our technology and innovation, partnerships and networks combine to deliver a unique set of products and services that help people, businesses and governments realize their greatest potential.*
**Title And Summary**
 Senior Software Engineer (Full Stack)
   

  

**Overview**
 We are building modern, customer-facing applications that provide intuitive access to our industry-leading threat intelligence data. Our mission is to make cybersecurity insights actionable and accessible through fast, reliable, and well-designed web experiences. These tools enable our customers to explore, visualize, and respond to threat data in real-time, helping them stay ahead of evolving risks.
   

  

 As part of this effort, we’re looking for an experienced fullstack engineer who is passionate about creating clean, scalable systems using Golang, TypeScript, and React. You’ll work closely with product, design, and security teams to build solutions that are both technically robust and deeply user-focused.
   

  

 Role
   

  

 As a Senior Software Engineer, you will play a key role in the design, development, and delivery of scalable web applications that serve our customers. You’ll take ownership of features across the stack, from designing backend APIs in Go to building responsive user interfaces in React. Your work will directly impact how customers interact with and act on cybersecurity data and insights.
   

  

**Primary Responsibilities**
* Design, build, and maintain fullstack applications using Golang (backend) and TypeScript/React (frontend).
* Develop and maintain scalable APIs and services that serve real-time data to customers.
* Collaborate with product managers and designers to implement intuitive, accessible, and performant user interfaces.
* Ensure high standards of code quality through testing, code reviews, and continuous improvement.
* Work with DevOps and platform teams to ensure applications are deployed reliably and monitored effectively.
* Optimize systems for performance and scalability as usage grows.
* Contribute to architectural decisions and influence the overall technical direction of customer-facing products.


**All About You**
* You are a product-minded engineer who cares deeply about the end-user experience.
* You thrive in a collaborative environment and enjoy working across disciplines.
* You bring strong engineering fundamentals, attention to detail, and a drive to ship high-quality software.
* You’re comfortable working independently on complex projects.


 You Have
   

  

* 5+ years of professional software engineering experience.
* Strong hands-on experience with Golang, TypeScript, and React.
* Proven experience building, scaling, and maintaining web applications in production environments.
* Deep understanding of API design, REST/GraphQL, and backend service architecture.
* Familiarity with modern frontend frameworks, build tools, and testing practices.
* Experience working in cloud-native environments (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes, AWS/GCP).
* Excellent communication skills and a strong desire to collaborate and share knowledge.
* A passion for clean code, automation, and continuous delivery.


 Nice to Have
   

  

* Experience working in security-focused environments or with cybersecurity data.
* Familiarity with authentication/authorization standards (OAuth2, SAML, JWT).
* Experience with observability tools (e.g., Prometheus, Grafana, Sentry).
* Understanding of accessibility and internationalization best practices.


 Why Join Us?
   

  

 This is your chance to build modern, impactful software that users rely on daily to navigate complex cybersecurity challenges. You’ll work on a collaborative team that values innovation, autonomy, and delivering value to customers.
   

  

**Corporate Security Responsibility**
 All activities involving access to Mastercard assets, information, and networks comes with an inherent risk to the organization and, therefore, it is expected that every person working for, or on behalf of, Mastercard is responsible for information security and must:
   

  

* Abide by Mastercard’s security policies and practices;
* Ensure the confidentiality and integrity of the information being accessed;
* Report any suspected information security violation or breach, and
* Complete all periodic mandatory security trainings in accordance with Mastercard’s guidelines.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**About Us**
 At Medius, we believe managing finance should be about strategy, not stress. That same mindset shapes not only the solutions we build, but also the culture we create for our people. We remove complexity, embrace innovation, and give our teams the freedom to focus on what truly matters — whether that’s transforming the future of finance with AI or finding balance to go home on time.
   

  

 Founded in Sweden in 2001, Medius has grown from a local startup into a global leader in cloud-based spend management solutions. Today, thousands of organizations worldwide trust us to simplify accounts payable and spend management processes. Our journey has been driven by continuous innovation, a passion for technology, and above all — the people who make it happen.
   

  

 We’re more than a software company. We’re a team of problem-solvers, innovators and collaborators working together to reinvent the category of accounts payable. Our solutions use Artificial Intelligence to eliminate manual work, bring clarity, confidence, and control, and empower finance teams of the future.
   

  

**At Medius,** 
 our values guide how we work and grow together:
   

  

* Connect – We believe in the power of people—individually and collectively—and our success depends on understanding and respecting each other. We appreciate that ‘empowering finance teams of the future’ is an exciting endeavor, and we share it with everyone around us.
* Question – We enjoy the challenge of our work and the thrill of collaboration. We are not afraid to question ourselves and each other because we believe diverse perspectives can lead to better outcomes and that there is great power in resolution.
* Own – We are thorough, thoughtful, and decisive. We anticipate what’s next, what a customer might need, and then we deliver. That’s how we get things done. And that’s how we remain a leader. Customers trust us to do our job so that they can focus on what they do best.


 At Medius, you’ll join a diverse, global community where curiosity is celebrated, ideas matter, and innovation never stops. If you’re passionate about technology, eager to make an impact, and ready to grow alongside a team that lives its values, Medius is where you can do your best work — and still have time to live your best life.
   

  

 Lear more at www.medius.com
   

  

**Job Overview**
 We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer, Tech Lead, or Architect with a proven track record in building and operating cloud-native systems. The ideal candidate is an analytical problem-solver who thrives in debugging complex, distributed applications in production and is passionate about creating secure, reliable, and scalable solutions.
   

  

**Responsibilities And Duties**
* Design, develop, and operate cloud-native applications with a focus on automation and observability.
* Debug and troubleshoot complex distributed applications in production environments.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams in an agile development environment.
* Ensure system reliability, security, and scalability are maintained across all applications.
* Contribute to architectural decisions and technology strategy, particularly around cloud-native solutions.


**Qualifications**
* Proven experience as a Senior Software Engineer, Tech Lead, or Architect.
* Strong proficiency in C# and .NET.
* Hands-on experience with cloud-native solutions, ideally including Service Fabric, AKS, Azure Storage, and Elasticsearch.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills for complex distributed systems.
* Familiarity with agile methodologies and cross-functional team collaboration.
* Passion for architecture, security, reliability, and scalability, with experience designing for automation and observability.


 Medius links invoice capture, processing, and payment to replace the worry and wondering of managing AP with calm and confidence. Medius goes far beyond basic automation by using artificial intelligence to do most of the work – so invoices get coded, approved and paid; customers get to go home and rest easy; and businesses can trust budgets and forecasts.
   

  

 For more information, please visit medius.com.
   

  

**Our values**
* Connect: We believe in the power of people, both individually and collectively. Our success is driven by respect and understanding, with a shared commitment to empowering finance teams of the future.
* Question: We embrace challenges and value diverse perspectives. By questioning and collaborating, we unlock better solutions and continuously innovate.
* Own: We are proactive, decisive, and committed to delivering results. We anticipate customer needs and follow through, earning their trust to focus on what they do best.

title: Fullstack Data & AI Developer
description:
**HAYPP GROUP**
 We address one of the world’s biggest problems – how to end smoking. There are 1,1 billion smokers in the world. Around 8 million people die every year from smoking-related diseases. Our goal is to significantly reduce death rates, save lives and inspire people to choose healthier enjoyment. How? By offering people safer nicotine online.
   

  

 Haypp Group is one of the Nordics’ leading e-commerce groups with ten store brands, present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 million active consumers. Through brands such as Snusbolaget.se, Northerner.com, Nicokick.com etc., we sell nicotine pouches, Swedish style snus online as well as disposable vapes. With our headquarters located on Östgötagatan in Stockholm we are 250 team members mainly but not exclusively based in Sweden. Also, we are an innovative and fast-moving company that is growing rapidly, driving sustainable business and are changing the world in the process. We are currently on an exciting expansion journey, converting more and more smokers to healthier alternatives across all our markets globally.
   

  

**THE ROLE**
 Join our Data Team as a Full Stack Applications/AI Developer, where you'll be at the forefront of transforming business processes through innovative Data & AI solutions. In this role, you'll develop comprehensive data heavy and AI applications that enhance operational efficiency across our organization. You'll work together with our Data Engineers & Analysts to create seamless, integrated systems that drive productivity and innovation. Experience in building enterprise-grade customer service chatbots is a plus but not required.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Data/AI Application Development:
+ Design, develop, test, and deploy full stack data heavy and AI applications that streamline business processes.
+ Integrate AI models with both front-end and back-end systems to ensure robust and user-friendly applications.

* Collaboration & Integration:
+ Work closely with the Data & Insights Team to translate business process into effective data and AI-driven solutions.
+ Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of applications with existing systems.

* Innovation & Continuous Improvement:
+ Research and implement cutting-edge AI technologies and frameworks to drive continuous improvement.
+ Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in AI and full stack development.

* Optional Chatbot Development:


 Utilize experience (if applicable) in building enterprise-grade customer service chatbots to enhance customer interaction channels.
   

  

**What We Want From You**
 For us, it is equally important to find the right fit on an interpersonal level between us and a new colleague as it is to find someone with the right experience and competence. Successful candidates also meet the following requirements
   

  

* Technical Expertise:
* Proven experience as a Fullstack Developer with a focus on AI and machine learning applications.
* Strong proficiency in Frontend and Backend technologies (e.g., JavaScript, Python, etc.).
* Experience with cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and containerization tools is highly desirable.
* Experience with AI & ML frameworks (LangGraph, Scikit-Learn, PyTorch, etc.) and RESTful API design.
* Collaborative Skills:
* Excellent problem-solving abilities and the capacity to work effectively in a multidisciplinary team.
* Strong communication skills to clearly articulate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Preferred Qualifications:
* Experience in developing enterprise-grade customer service chatbots is an added advantage.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (Master’s degree preferred).


**What We Offer**
 We are a value driven company with our values
 *We team up* 
 ,
 *Innovation Drives Us* 
 ,
 *No Douchebags* 
 and
 *Going the Extra Mile* 
 at the heartbeat of everything that we do. With us you can always expect to get help from people who want to achieve things together and to be able to speak your mind in every social constellation you are part of. We highly value all ideas no matter where they come from, and we are not afraid to try new things out. We are also welcoming, inclusive and everyone at Haypp Group has a voice. In addition, we seize opportunities by putting in hands-on, hard work and celebrating when we reach our goals. With us, you should always feel safe, appreciated and valued but at the same time challenged and excited.
   

  

**Benefits**
 Because we recognize that our team members are our most important differentiator, we offer our team members generous benefits. We offer the following perks to everyone at Haypp Group:
   

  

* Premium ITP1 occupational pension savings plan
* Insurance plan, including private healthcare
* 30 days of paid vacation
* Parental pay lift
* Wellness allowance of 5,000 SEK per year
* Lots of social happenings


**SEND US YOUR APPLICATION TODAY!**
 If this sounds like a place where you would want to contribute and grow, let us know you’re interested by submitting your application! Apply with your CV, a cover letter, through Linkedin or in any other way you feel represents you in the clearest possible way. All ways of connecting work for us!
   

  

 Haypp Group is committed to equality and diversity, and we welcome applications from all qualified individuals regardless of ethnicity, religion, age, gender, sexual orientation, disability, and marital status. We want to offer you great recruitment experience, and if there is anything we can do to make you more comfortable in the process with us, please let us know.
   

  

 If you have any questions about the role or what it’s like to work at Haypp Group in general, feel free to reach out to our responsible recruiter Lea Sjösten at lea.sjosten@hayppgroup.com. We look forward to hearing from you!
   

  

 The Haypp Group is spearheading the global transformation from smoking to healthier product alternatives. With origins in Scandinavia our extensive experience from pioneering markets in smoke free alternatives, as well as being a leader in the e-commerce sector, we now fully bring our vision to a global scale.
   

  

 With ten e-commerce brands, the Haypp Group is present in seven countries where we serve more than 1 100 000 consumers.

title: Software Engineer
description:
*Vill du göra samhällsnytta och bidra till Sveriges oberoende i världen? Vi söker nu en teknisk rockstar som är vass på Java och inte blir avskräckt av riktigt stora datamängder. Du är alltid hungrig på nya kunskaper och vill använda din dyrbara tid till att göra Sverige säkrare. På FRA arbetar vi med unika uppgifter – för Sveriges säkerhet och integritet.*
**Ditt uppdrag**
 I rollen som Software Engineer utvecklar och underhåller du lösningar som tolkar, bearbetar och lagrar stora mängder inhämtad data. Vidare utvecklar du även användarapplikationer som gör data tillgänglig för användning i verksamhetens underrättelseproduktion. Världen förändras och så även vårt data. Därför sker kontinuerlig utveckling i takt med att nya krav och behov uppstår.
   

  

 Du kommer att ingå i ett team med helhetsansvar för sina system. Teamet jobbar agilt med eget ansvar för utveckling och drift av hela stacken.
   

  

 Teamet har ett nära samarbete med andra delar inom produktionen av analys och bearbetningsförmågor. Både med slutanvändare och andra tekniska team som förser systemet med data.
   

  

 Vi strävar alltid efter att våra medarbetare ska trivas och utvecklas. Vi ser det som en förutsättning för teamets effektivitet. Via utbildningar, konferenser och egen omvärldsbevakning håller vi oss uppdaterade på den senaste tekniken. Tillsammans utvärderar vi och tar del av varandras insikter.
   

  

**Du kan**
**Du Har Följande Kompetens/erfarenhet**
* Goda kunskaper i Java
* JavaScript / TypeScript
* Högskoleutbildning inom datateknik, systemvetenskap eller motsvarande alternativt förvärvat motsvarande kompetens genom arbetslivserfarenhet
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i såväl tal som skrift


 För Oss Är Det Viktigt Att Du Är Nyfiken, Ödmjuk, Har Ett Driv Att Lära Dig Nya Saker. Det Är Även Meriterande För Tjänsten Om Du Har Erfarenhet Från Ett Eller Flera Av Följande Områden
   

  

* Big Data
* Iceberg / Delta Lake
* Relationsdatabaser
* NoSQL-databaser
* Spark
* Trino
* Angular
* Linux
* Kubernetes / Docker
* Informationsmodellering/Datamodellering


**Du är**
 Vi kommer lägga stor vikt vid dina personliga egenskaper. Därför tror vi att du till din natur är nyfiken på nya tekniker och håller dig uppdaterad om vad som händer, både vad gäller arbetsmetoder och nya produkter. Du delar entusiastiskt med dig av dina kunskaper och lockas av möjligheten att vara med och påverka framtida teknikval och lösningar. Dessutom tycker du det är spännande och känner en stolthet i att få vara med och bygga utökad underrättelseförmåga för FRA.
   

  

**Om FRA**
 FRA har omvärlden som sin arena där varje arbetsuppgift är en del av något större. På ett eller annat sätt får du som medarbetare vara med och bidra till att skydda Sveriges integritet och oberoende i världen. Du är med och gör skillnad på riktigt, varje dag.
   

  

 Vår uppgift som underrättelsetjänst är att skydda Sverige mot de allvarligaste hot som kan riktas mot ett samhälle – militära angrepp, terrorism och cyberattacker. Vi skyddar det viktigaste vi har – vår trygghet, vår demokrati och vårt sätt att leva. Vi är experter på cyberområdet och signalspaning samt en larmklocka för militära hot.
   

  

 FRA leder sedan 2024 Nationellt cybersäkerhetscenter, NCSC vars uppdrag är att utveckla och stärka Sveriges förmåga att förebygga, upptäcka och hantera cyberhot.
   

  

 Som nyanställd på FRA får du en omfattande introduktionsutbildning och kontinuerlig kompetensutveckling, vilket ger dig möjlighet att utveckla dina färdigheter och bli ännu bättre på det du brinner för. Vår organisation är mångfacetterad och består av olika kompetenser och personligheter, där varje individ har unika egenskaper och förutsättningar.
