 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket är det extra viktigt med en kort motivering för tjänsten som förklarar hur man möter kraven.

title: Musti Group – QA Lead, Digital
description:
**About Musti Group**


Musti makes the life of pets and their owners easier, safer and more fun. We are the leading Nordic pet care company and we operate an omnichannel business model to cater for the needs of pets and their owners across Finland, Sweden, Norway and the Baltics. We offer a wide, curated assortment of pet products. We also provide pet care services such as grooming, training and veterinary services in selected locations.


Musti Group’s net sales were EUR 444 million in 2024. We have over 2,000 employees, 1,9 million customers and 415 stores.

*Read more about us!*

 **We are now looking for a new talent to join us as**

**QA Lead for our Digital team at Musti Group**


Musti Group is in an interesting phase of renewing our whole digital ecosystem to better support further expansion. At our eCommerce and customer domain we are transforming both the platform and the team to be more growth-oriented and to work better towards our business objectives without compromising the quality of our technical platforms.


As our QA Lead, you are responsible for ensuring the quality of delivery across our entire digital platform, including our eCommerce platform as well as CRM, loyalty and services management. You will spend your time designing, improving and implementing our test strategies, and collaborating with our team consisting of a scrum master, developers and UX designers. QA is a new role within our digital team so you will have responsibility of driving this area and be hands-on with our test strategy implementation.


**What you will do**

* Be responsible of driving and implementing our test strategy
* Test case management for both manual and automated tests
* Implement and develop test cases and test automation
* Coach developers and the wider team on QA practices and ways of working
* Ensure our platform meets the quality standards expected by customers and our internal stakeholders

**Who you are**

* 5+ years of experience in Quality Assurance, with at least 2 years in a senior or lead QA role in e-commerce
* Experience in testing Salesforce Commerce Cloud (B2C) and Salesforce Core (Oms/Service Cloud)
* Expertise in test cases management (Atomic and E2E)
* Expertise in defect management
* Expertise in key testing methodologies and types (functional, regression & smoke, UAT)
* Experience with Integration Testing and E2E testing (3rd party APIs, payment gateways, ERP systems)
* Familiarity with Agile/Scrum methodologies
* Strong communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative, team-oriented environment

**What we consider as a plus**

* Strong experience with testing Ecommerce Storefront headless solutions
* Experience with test automation (playwright)
* Experience with CI/CD and its establishment process
* Knowledge of Salesforce architecture, APIs, data models, workflows, object relationships, multi-cloud environments and integration points
* Familiar with Salesforce deployments, sandboxes, and environment management
* Experience using Salesforce Inspector, Workbench, and SOQL queries for validation
* Salesforce certifications (e.g., Salesforce Associate, Salesforce Administrator, Salesforce Advanced Administrator, Salesforce Platform App Builder)
* Finnish or Swedish language skills

**Why to join our pack?**


We offer you diverse and inspiring work in the rapidly growing and evolving business of one of the leading pet retail companies. You will join us as our first QA so you will have the opportunity to shape this area and practices within wider IT.


We believe in fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation, giving you the freedom and responsibility to do your work. We have flexible working hours and a flexible remote work policy to support you in your work, as well as wellbeing and other local benefits.


For this position, your main location can be Helsinki or Stockholm. Please note that for this position we cannot offer relocation. We often have dogs in the office; therefore, the work might not be suitable for a person who is allergic to pets.

**Next steps**


If you have any questions, please contact Tiina Korvenoja tiina.korvenoja[at]mustigroup.com


Please submit your CV and application **in English** by **22nd September** at the latest. Please also note that we cannot offer relocation package for this role. We will contact all applicants latest one week after the application period closes but may start interviews already earlier.

title: Musti Group – UX/UI Designer
description:
**About Musti Group**


Musti makes the life of pets and their owners easier, safer and more fun. We are the leading Nordic pet care company and we operate an omnichannel business model to cater for the needs of pets and their owners across Finland, Sweden, Norway and the Baltics. We offer a wide, curated assortment of pet products. We also provide pet care services such as grooming, training and veterinary services in selected locations.


Musti Group’s net sales were EUR 444 million in 2024. We have over 2,000 employees, 1,9 million customers and 415 stores.

*Read more about us!*

 **We are now looking for a new talent to join us as**

**UX/UI Designer for our Digital team at Musti Group**


Musti Group is in an interesting phase of renewing our whole digital ecosystem to better support further expansion. At our eCommerce and customer domain we are transforming both the platform and the team to be more growth-oriented and to work better towards our business objectives without compromising the quality of our technical platforms.


As our UX/UI designer you will be responsible for shaping every step of the customer journey across all of our eCommerce shops, including purchase experience, services, knowledge articles and much more. You’ll spend your time designing user-friendly interfaces, prototypes and developing our design system together with our senior UX/UI designer. You will also work closely together with our developers, scrum master and product owners to ensure that our future eCommerce has both business value and technical excellence.


**What you will do**

* Design user-friendly, intuitive interfaces for our 6 eCommerce shops that help us drive growth online
* Contribute and drive user research and turn insights into wireframes and prototypes
* Work closely with our senior UX/UI designer, Frontend Lead developer and other developers to bring your designs into life

**Who you are**

* 3+ years of working experience as UX/UI designer, preferably within e-commerce or digital products
* Solid skills in Figma (or similar tools) and working with design systems (e.g. storybook)
* Experience in conducting A/B tests and interpreting results
* Experience in working with developers and as part of agile teams
* Experience in conducting user research such as interviews, questionnaires and focus groups
* Experience in facilitating workshops and discussions with internal stakeholders

**What we consider as a plus**

* Working experience within retail brands
* Working experience with multi-brand, international companies
* Familiarity with HTML/CSS to understand basics of translating design to code
* Knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG) and designing for inclusivity
* Swedish or Finnish skills

**Why join our pack?**


We offer you diverse and inspiring work in the rapidly growing and evolving business of one of the leading pet retail companies. UX/UI Design is a vital part of Musti Group’s future online success, and our different brands will truly offer you a challenge to develop in your work.


We believe in fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation, giving you the freedom and responsibility to do your work. We have flexible working hours and a flexible remote work policy to support you in your work, as well as well-being and other local benefits.


For this position, your main location can be Helsinki or Stockholm. Please note that for this position we cannot offer relocation. We often have dogs in the office; therefore, the work might not be suitable for a person who is allergic to pets.

**Next steps**


If you have any questions, please contact Tiina Korvenoja tiina.korvenoja[at]mustigroup.com


Please submit your CV and application **in English** by **22nd September** at the latest. Please also note that we cannot offer relocation package for this role. We will contact all applicants at the latest one week after the application period closes but may start interviews already earlier.

title: Product Analyst, Mobility Vertical
description:
**THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL**


**You?** You are an experienced product analyst with e-commerce, digital product, or marketplace background, bringing strong skills in SQL, modern data stacks, behavioural analysis, and experimentation.


**Role**? You will empower the Product teams to make data-driven decisions and drive product development through insights, instrumentation and experimentation.


**Tech stack?**


* Essential skills: Our tech stack includes Snowflake SQL, Tableau, and Amplitude. Equivalent experience with tools such as Power BI or Google Analytics is equally valuable.
* Bonus skills/experience: A/B testing, dbt, Python, Kafka, Data Mesh principles, Machine Learning, Google Slides.


**Location?** Work hybrid, spending a few days a week at our modern offices in Stockholm, Oslo, or Aarhus to promote team collaboration. Prefer an office environment? You’re welcome to join us daily.


**Company?** Vend is home to leading and loved marketplace brands across the Nordics — Tori, Oikotie, and Autovex in Finland; FINN and Nettbil in Norway; Blocket, Bytbil, and Wheelaway in Sweden; and DBA & Bilbasen in Denmark. Every day, millions of people across the region turn to our platforms to find what they need — whether it’s a job, a home, a way to move, or a fresh start. Together, our users generate billions of behavioural data points, which creates a unique opportunity to work with incredibly rich data sets while shaping the future of how people buy and sell cars, boats, and motorcycles. Currently, we’re in a historic change, consolidating to a common marketplace platform across the Nordics.


**The team?** You will join the Mobility Insight & Analytics team: six product and business analysts and one data scientist, based across the Nordics. We support product teams and business stakeholders within the Mobility vertical i.e., Cars, Boats and Motorcycles. We collaborate closely with data platform teams e.g. Data and Analytics Engineers, and horizontal Insight & Analytics team.


**Why us?** In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact by working with vast amounts of data from across the Nordics. Our marketplaces generate billions of behavioural data points each month, giving you the chance to uncover patterns, guide decision-making, and shape the future of digital Mobility experiences. We hold strong, unique positions across all our segments in the Nordics. Specifically, the Mobility vertical is driving transformation in electrification and the online buying experience, creating a dynamic environment full of opportunities. At our core, we unite across countries, brands, and teams, embracing a culture where we dare to speak up, challenge the status quo, and try new things. We take pride in delivering on our promises and turning bold ideas into real impact.



Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!


**WHO ARE YOU?**


* You bring 5+ years of experience as a product analyst in e-commerce, digital product or marketplace companies.
* You have experience working with modern data stacks, behavioural analysis and experimentation.
* You are highly skilled in SQL and have an understanding and interest in the whole data value chain, especially from modelling business logic on prepared data to delivering and presenting impactful insights for stakeholders.
* You thrive in a fast-changing environment, balancing the need to maintain high data quality with the curiosity to dig deeper and uncover the bigger picture.
* Acting as the link between technical and business stakeholders comes naturally to you. You build strong relationships with colleagues and stakeholders, and value collaboration and shared success.
* You communicate data and insights in an engaging and visual way and switch between details and overviews to navigate complex business landscapes. You are able to explain data clearly at all levels.
* You turn vast data into actionable insights, elevating our understanding of marketplace user behaviour.
* You’re motivated by the opportunity to evolve alongside a company — and an industry — that’s constantly moving.
* A passion for cars, boats, or motorcycles is a plus.


**WHAT'S THE JOB LIKE?**


* Analyze and translate user behavior and product performance into actionable insights using product analytics tools.
* Act as an enabler for product teams across the Mobility vertical: advise on hypotheses, identify data and tracking needs, define KPIs, and ensure insights drive real impact.
* Help set up and analyze experiments to support data-informed product development.
* Ensure we maintain high data quality while contributing to continuous product evolution.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (developers, product managers, UX, data engineers) as well as other analysts across the Nordics.
* Stay up to date on product development and analytics methods.


**WHAT WE OFFER**



At Vend, we offer a range of benefits designed to support your well-being, professional growth and work-life balance. Note that specific benefits may vary by office location.


* Learning & Development: Access to Vend Learning Lab, external courses, conferences, Hackdays, and leadership development programs.
* Health & Wellbeing: Comprehensive health insurance, mental health support, and other well being.
* Parental Leave: Enhanced parental leave benefits
* Pension & Insurance: Defined contribution pension plans and extensive insurance coverage, including accident, critical illness, and travel insurance.
* Food & Social Activities: Subsidized healthy meals, barista coffee, and various social events like after-work, gatherings, holiday parties, and family activities.
* Employee Share Saving Plan: Opportunity to buy shares with additional complimentary shares after two years.
* Home Office Support: Office equipment for home office setup.


**GOT YOUR ATTENTION?**



We will review the applications **on rolling basis** so apply as soon as possible, where you can share knowledge, learn, grow and make a difference. We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Inclusion for us means creating a fair workspace where each of us is respected, celebrated for who we are, and given equal opportunities to thrive. Application deadline for this role is **1st October 2025**


  
**Great Place to Work**
-----------------------

We embrace diversity


Learn smarter, with our AI powered Learning Lab


Work with products that matter in people's lives


1700 fantastic colleagues in 4 Nordic countries


Smart choices made easy on our marketplaces


Innovation, it’s at our core

title: Global Web Manager
description:
Marketing · Stockholm · Hybridarbete
**Global Web Manager**
======================


**JumpYard söker Web Manager! Driv global webbstrategi, optimera bokningsflöden och skapa digitala kundresor som inspirerar och konverterar.**
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

  



Vill du skapa en digital upplevelse som inspirerar, konverterar och driver tillväxt över flera marknader? JumpYard söker nu en erfaren **Global** **Web Manager** med globalt ansvar för våra webbplatser – från strategi till daglig optimering.

  

**Om JumpYard:**  

Vår första park i Sverige, JumpYard Barkarby, invigdes 2017 och redan från start kunde vi erbjuda fler aktiviteter än bara trampoliner.


Efter JumpYard Barkarby har vi öppnat fler parker i Sverige, Danmark, Norge, Spanien, Portugal och snart Tyskland! Utvecklingen av våra parker går fort framåt och idag kan våra gäster uppleva aktiviteter som Clip ‘N Climb, Sky Rider, Valo Jump, olika ninjabanor och mycket mer.


Framgången består förstås i människors förtjusta inställning till rörelseglädje! En annan viktig framgångsfaktor är vår personal – med fokus på gästupplevelse, flexibilitet och inspiration ger de gästerna valuta för inträdet sju dagar i veckan året runt. Nu söker vi en Global Web Manager till vårt globala marknadsteam. Vill du bli en del av JumpYard och ha #seriouslyfun tillsammans med oss?  

  



**Om rollen:**

  

Som Global Web Manager ansvarar du för hela vår webbplats och är både strateg och doer. Du leder utvecklingen av våra webbplatser – med fokus på strategi, struktur, innehåll, bokningsflöden och konvertering.

  

Du optimerar hela kundresan – från startsida till tack-sida – och säkerställer att webbplatserna följer företagets varumärkesstrategi, visuella identitet och kommunikationsriktlinjer. Rollen är global, men det operativa arbetet sker främst för Norden. För Spanien och Portugal har du stöd av en kollega, men du sätter ramar och kvalitet även där.


Även om JumpYard inte är en klassisk e-handlare är vår affär bokningsdriven. Du har erfarenhet av att optimera konverteringsflöden – från startsida till checkout – och vet hur man skapar sömlösa digitala kundresor inspirerade av e-commerce och CRO-metodik.

**Dina ansvarsområden**

* Utveckla och driva vår globala webbstrategi med affärsmål och kundbehov i fokus
* Du driver ett datadrivet arbetssätt för att ständigt förbättra konvertering och lönsamhet.
* Säkerställa en inspirerande, intuitiv och konverterande bokningsupplevelse
* Säkerställa att webbplatserna följer varumärkesstrategi, visuell identitet och kommunikationsriktlinjer
* Optimera UX/UI, laddningstider, navigation och mobilanpassning
* Arbeta i WordPress med innehåll, struktur och visuell uppdatering (främst för Norden)
* Identifiera och åtgärda friktion i användarflöden och mikrointeraktioner
* Genomföra A/B-tester och heatmap-analyser, driva hypotesdriven optimering
* Analysera försäljning och besöksdata (GA4, Hotjar eller liknande) och agera på insikter
* Koordinera globala webkampanjer och lokal anpassning av innehåll
* Samarbeta nära contentteamet och externa byråer för en enhetlig kundresa

 **Vi söker dig som har:**


* Relevant utbildning inom digital marknadsföring, UX, e-handel eller webbteknik.
* Minst 4 års erfarenhet i en roll med ansvar för webbstrategi, konverteringsoptimering och digital affärsutveckling.
* Dokumenterad erfarenhet av att driva större webbprojekt från strategi till implementation – gärna i en internationell kontext.
* Stark e-commerce mindset och vana att optimera bokningsflöden, checkout och kundresor för maximal konvertering.
* Mycket god kompetens inom CRO, A/B-tester, heatmaps och hypotesdriven optimering.
* Djup förståelse för UX/UI, användarcentrerad design och digitala beteenden.
* God teknisk förståelse för CMS (gärna WordPress), webbutveckling och digital infrastruktur.
* Avancerade kunskaper i SEO och webbanalys (GA4, Hotjar eller liknande).
* Självgående, initiativtagande och lösningsorienterad – trygg i att prioritera och ta beslut med affärsnytta i fokus.

* 

*Detta är en 100 % tjänst. Du kommer att vara placerad i Stockholm och rapportera till Nordic Marketing Manager.*


Välkommen med din ansökan – rekrytering sker löpande och tjänsten önskar vi tillsätta omgående.

  

Avdelning
Marketing
Platser
Stockholm
Distansarbete
Hybridarbete
Kontakt Eva Lopez Jarl Nordic Marketing Manager – Marketing
**Kollegor**
------------

Eva Lopez Jarl
Nordic Marketing Manager
  
**Stockholm**
-------------


  
**Arbetsplats och kultur**
--------------------------


Vi är en plats där man kan umgås, träffa nya vänner, prova nya saker, misslyckas och försöka igen. En energisk atmosfär med härlig stämning där vi har seriously fun tillsammans!

  

Vi är en timme av rörelse innan läxorna. En helg med familjetid. Ett sommarläger där du kan utmanas och växa. Vi är en actionfylld park för alla som vill få en boost av puls och nöje.

  

Men vi är inte bara en park. Vi är en sammansvetsad familj av Yarders som alltid är glada över att se varandra och våra gäster. Hoppas du vill bli en del av vår familj!


  
**Om JumpYard**
---------------

JumpYard driver aktivitetscenter för främst barn och ungdomar, där kombinationen lek, rörelse och glädje är i fokus.  

Våra parker erbjuder fler aktiviteter än bara trampolinhoppning, då vi anser att alla ska kunna, och vilja hitta sin egen utmaning.  

Vi har parker i Sverige, Danmark, Norge, Portugal och Spanien.



Grundades 2017
Medarbetare 1000
Omsättning 500M SEK

title: UX-Designer
description:
Solna


Referensnummer 2025/051825


På Arbetsmiljöverket jobbar vi tillsammans för att ingen ska bli sjuk, skadas eller dö av jobbet. Därför hjälper vi arbetsgivare att uppfylla de krav som finns och informerar om hur arbetsmiljöarbetet blir en naturlig del av vardagen. Med arbetsmiljölagen som grund tar vi fram regler, inspekterar arbetsplatser och sprider kunskap om arbetsmiljöfrågor. Uppdraget är allvarligt men vår vardag präglas av arbetsglädje och vi är omtänksamma och hjälpsamma kollegor.


**Ditt nya jobb**
-----------------



Du blir en del av Arbetsmiljöverkets enhet för digitalisering. Vi arbetar tillsammans med kollegor från samtliga verksamhetsområden (modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare, vardagshjältar och problemlösare), med digital utveckling inom tre områden:


* Idé och innovation
* Digital utveckling
* Digital förvaltning


Du arbetar med dina kollegor på enheten och från olika delar av verksamheten.



Du arbetar i team med olika kompetenser, roller och funktioner, som delar djup kunskap och perspektiv. Tillsammans utforskar vi nya områden och bidrar till att ingen ska bli sjuk, skadas eller dö av jobbet.



Som UX-designer ansvarar du för att arbeta med och ta fram användarcentrerade och tillgänglighetsanpassade designlösningar för flöden för våra e-tjänster, digitala produkter och verktyg. Du har god erfarenhet av att planera och facilitera workshops, intervjuer, behovskartläggning och paketera insikterna på ett pedagogiskt sätt. Du undersöker och utgår från användarnas behov, situation och beteenden i arbetet med att utforma produkter, tjänster och lösningar på bästa tänkbara sätt. Du skapar prototyper och koncept för att visualisera och kunna testa olika designlösningar. Du genomför tester och intervjuer för att samla in feedback och förbättra användarupplevelsen.



I ditt arbete utgår du från våra beslutade designsystem, som du även underhåller och uppdaterar. Du kommunicerar designbeslut och samarbetar med andra designers, utvecklare och intressenter i olika förvaltnings- och projektteam. Du arbetar med att utforma användargränssnitt (UI) som är tydliga, enkla, relevanta, intuitiva, med hög användarbarhet för målgrupperna, som fungerar och är genomförbara i vår tekniska miljö. Du analyserar användardata för att identifiera förbättringsområden och mäta effekten av designlösningar.



Du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med olika förvaltnings- och projektteam. Ditt uppdrag är att designa enkla och intuitiva lösningar som fungerar och är genomförbara i vår tekniska miljö.


**Din bakgrund**
----------------



Rollen kräver att du har:


* Du har akademisk examen/eftergymnasial utbildning inom UX-design, tjänstedesign, interaktionsdesign eller annat lämpligt område, alternativt motsvarande utbildning eller erfarenhet som Arbetsmiljöverket bedömer som likvärdig.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att ha jobbat som UX-designer och kunskap inom Figma och/eller andra prototypverktyg.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med utvecklingsarbeten och förändringsprocesser inom digitalisering, digital utveckling och/eller verksamhetsutveckling.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet och kunskap av metodik inom UX-och UI-design, behovsdriven utveckling, interaktion och att tex leda workshops och behovsutredningar.
* God förståelse för tillgänglig design och kraven på tillgänglighet inom offentlig sektor, såsom DOS-lagen och WCAG 2.2.


Det är meriterande om du även har:


* Erfarenhet från verksamhetsförändringar som leder till mer datadrivna och digitaliserade arbetssätt.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med liknande uppgifter i en större, komplex organisation, gärna inom offentlig sektor.
* Det är meriterande med erfarenhet av att driva förstudiearbete.
* Arbete med designsystem och designprinciper.
* Erfarenhet av AI-verktyg


För att lyckas i uppdraget behöver du ha en stark egen motor, kunna kommunicera tydligt inspirera till förändring. Du är uthållig och har tålamod med att processer kan vara långa och/eller utmanande. Vid urvalet lägger vi stor vikt vid din personliga lämplighet och din förmåga att skapa goda samarbeten.



En anställning hos oss kan innebära att befattningen placeras i säkerhetsklass. Säkerhetsprövning med eller utan registerkontroll kan därför komma att göras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning genomförs enligt Säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).


**Vad vi erbjuder dig**
-----------------------



Arbetsmiljöverket är en trygg arbetsgivare och en myndighet som hela tiden förändras med samhället vi verkar i. Vi är stolta över att få använda vår kunskap och vårt förtroende i vårt viktiga samhällsuppdrag. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande kultur, som rymmer hjärta, mod och hjärna. Hos oss blir hela du en viktig del i något större.



Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning, på heltid och är för närvarande placerad på vårt kontor i Solna. Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning och provanställning på sex månader.



Vi strävar efter att alla medarbetare ska ha en hållbar arbetsmiljö och en balans mellan jobb och fritid. Därför har vi flexibla arbetstider eller tillämpar förtroendearbetstid och ger möjlighet till distansarbete där verksamheten så tillåter.

  


**Så rekryterar vi**
--------------------



Vi använder kompetensbaserad rekrytering, både för att kvalitetssäkra rekryteringen och för att motverka diskriminering. Vi ber dig därför att endast bifoga ett CV och svara på några frågor, istället för ett personligt brev när du registrerar din an. Eftersom vi arbetar kompetensbaserat använder vi oss också av arbetspsykologiska tester i den här rekryteringen. Intervjuer sker från vecka 39.



Vi tycker att det är viktigt att även du får göra din bedömning av oss. Därför välkomnar vi frågor före såväl som under rekryteringsprocessen. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Adam Jansson för Saco, Eva Parissay för ST samt Jenny Bengtsson för Seko. Samtliga nås via Arbetsmiljöverkets växel: 010-730 90 00.



Vill du jobba tillsammans med oss för att ingen ska bli sjuk, skadas eller dö av jobbet?



Välkommen med din an senast den 18 september 2025!



Rekryteringen sköts av Arbetsmiljöverkets rekryteringsfunktion varför vi undanber oss säljsamtal från rekryteringsföretag eller annonssäljare.


**Kontaktpersoner**
-------------------


Izabella Cardestål Poshtkohi


Rekryterare


010- 730 94 96


izabella.cardestal.poshtkohi@av.se


Nina Burman


Enhetschef


08-730 90 00


nina.burman@av.se

  

  

Du er senast 2025-09-18 genom att klicka på knappen.

title: Digital Designer
description:
**Do you want to design experiences and bring creative, user-centered ideas to life for world class clients?** 




  






 Twain Studios is a design studio in Stockholm. We work within both digital product design and creative/marketing. Our specialty is creating solutions that overcome corporate hurdles and constraints while driving business outcomes through a strong focus on conversion.
 




  






 We are proud to work with well known global brands as well as exciting startups.
 




  






 We believe in simple solutions to complex problems. Doing things a little bit differently. And having fun doing it. At Twain, the output of every person matters. Some principles we value are; speed, user focus, collaboration, curiosity, and ownership.
 




  






 Right now we are looking for a digital designer to join one of our largest design engagements with a multinational client, bringing global marketing campaigns to life in digital.
 




  





**What will you do?** 



* Work on end-to-end digital marketing projects - from initial brief through concept, design and launch
* Collaborate with the client as well as other agencies on creative, best-in-class digital experiences
* Conduct research to understand user needs and identify insights and pain points
* Solve complex problems and translate requirements and needs into concepts, wireframes and prototypes
* Produce and present high-fidelity designs and facilitate hand-over to local markets through agile methodologies and ceremonies



  





**Who are you?** 



* A digital designer with professional experience and a relevant degree
* Interested and curious about all aspects of digital design - UX, UI, visual design, video and communication strategy
* A problem solver with ideas that challenge the ordinary, together with the drive – and the guts – to bring them to life
* A creative, empathic person who understands the needs of the user, and has the ability to communicate your ideas and insights
* Someone with a ‘here to help’ attitude, who loves collaborating with others, both within the team and on the client side



  





**Who are we?** 




  




* A young agency with world-class clients right from the get-go, founded by experienced digital professionals
* A flexible environment - we trust you to provide the drive and agency, and in return you set your own schedule around your responsibilities. We trust you.
* A supportive, collaborative environment where we help each other grow and learn

title: Musti Group – UX/UI Designer
description:
**About Musti Group**
 Musti makes the life of pets and their owners easier, safer and more fun. We are the leading Nordic pet care company and we operate an omnichannel business model to cater for the needs of pets and their owners across Finland, Sweden, Norway and the Baltics. We offer a wide, curated assortment of pet products. We also provide pet care services such as grooming, training and veterinary services in selected locations.
   

  

 Musti Group’s net sales were EUR 444 million in 2024. We have over 2,000 employees, 1,9 million customers and 415 stores.
   

  

*Read more about us!*
**We are now looking for a new talent to join us as**
**UX/UI Designer for our Digital team at Musti Group**
 Musti Group is in an interesting phase of renewing our whole digital ecosystem to better support further expansion. At our eCommerce and customer domain we are transforming both the platform and the team to be more growth-oriented and to work better towards our business objectives without compromising the quality of our technical platforms.
   

  

 As our UX/UI designer you will be responsible for shaping every step of the customer journey across all of our eCommerce shops, including purchase experience, services, knowledge articles and much more. You’ll spend your time designing user-friendly interfaces, prototypes and developing our design system together with our senior UX/UI designer. You will also work closely together with our developers, scrum master and product owners to ensure that our future eCommerce has both business value and technical excellence.
   

  

**What You Will Do**
* Design user-friendly, intuitive interfaces for our 6 eCommerce shops that help us drive growth online
* Contribute and drive user research and turn insights into wireframes and prototypes
* Work closely with our senior UX/UI designer, Frontend Lead developer and other developers to bring your designs into life


**Who You Are**
* 3+ years of working experience as UX/UI designer, preferably within e-commerce or digital products
* Solid skills in Figma (or similar tools) and working with design systems (e.g. storybook)
* Experience in conducting A/B tests and interpreting results
* Experience in working with developers and as part of agile teams
* Experience in conducting user research such as interviews, questionnaires and focus groups
* Experience in facilitating workshops and discussions with internal stakeholders


**What We Consider As a Plus**
* Working experience within retail brands
* Working experience with multi-brand, international companies
* Familiarity with HTML/CSS to understand basics of translating design to code
* Knowledge of accessibility standards (WCAG) and designing for inclusivity
* Swedish or Finnish skills


**Why join our pack?**
 We offer you diverse and inspiring work in the rapidly growing and evolving business of one of the leading pet retail companies. UX/UI Design is a vital part of Musti Group’s future online success, and our different brands will truly offer you a challenge to develop in your work.
   

  

 We believe in fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation, giving you the freedom and responsibility to do your work. We have flexible working hours and a flexible remote work policy to support you in your work, as well as well-being and other local benefits.
   

  

 For this position, your main location can be Helsinki or Stockholm. Please note that for this position we cannot offer relocation. We often have dogs in the office; therefore, the work might not be suitable for a person who is allergic to pets.
   

  

**Next steps**
 If you have any questions, please contact Tiina Korvenoja tiina.korvenoja[at]mustigroup.com
   

  

 Please submit your CV and application
 **in English** 
 by
 **22nd September** 
 at the latest. Please also note that we cannot offer relocation package for this role. We will contact all applicants at the latest one week after the application period closes but may start interviews already earlier.
   

  

 Arken Zoo grundades 1987 och är Sveriges största detaljhandelskedja för husdjursprodukter, med ca 115 butiker runt om I landet. Sedan 2015 ingår Arken Zoo i Musti Group, med totalt nästan 250 butiker i Norden.
   

  

 Genom våra fysiska butiker, veterinärkliniker, hundfrisörsalonger och e-handel erbjuder vi ett brett och prisvärt sortiment med produkter och tjänster av högsta kvalitet för ditt husdjur.
   

  

 Viktigare än vår storlek är vår vision om att göra livet enklare, säkrare och roligare – för husdjur, hussar och mattar.
   

  

 Välkommen till Arken Zoo. Vi älskar djur. Djur älskar oss.

title: UX-Designer
description:
På Arbetsmiljöverket jobbar vi tillsammans för att ingen ska bli sjuk, skadas eller dö av jobbet. Därför hjälper vi arbetsgivare att uppfylla de krav som finns och informerar om hur arbetsmiljöarbetet blir en naturlig del av vardagen. Med arbetsmiljölagen som grund tar vi fram regler, inspekterar arbetsplatser och sprider kunskap om arbetsmiljöfrågor. Uppdraget är allvarligt men vår vardag präglas av arbetsglädje och vi är omtänksamma och hjälpsamma kollegor.
   

  

 Ditt nya jobb
   

  

 Du blir en del av Arbetsmiljöverkets enhet för digitalisering. Vi arbetar tillsammans med kollegor från samtliga verksamhetsområden (modiga pionjärer och kluriga tänkare, vardagshjältar och problemlösare), med digital utveckling inom tre områden:
   

  

* Idé och innovation
* Digital utveckling
* Digital förvaltning


 Du arbetar med dina kollegor på enheten och från olika delar av verksamheten.
   

  

 Du arbetar i team med olika kompetenser, roller och funktioner, som delar djup kunskap och perspektiv. Tillsammans utforskar vi nya områden och bidrar till att ingen ska bli sjuk, skadas eller dö av jobbet.
   

  

 Som UX-designer ansvarar du för att arbeta med och ta fram användarcentrerade och tillgänglighetsanpassade designlösningar för flöden för våra e-tjänster, digitala produkter och verktyg. Du har god erfarenhet av att planera och facilitera workshops, intervjuer, behovskartläggning och paketera insikterna på ett pedagogiskt sätt. Du undersöker och utgår från användarnas behov, situation och beteenden i arbetet med att utforma produkter, tjänster och lösningar på bästa tänkbara sätt. Du skapar prototyper och koncept för att visualisera och kunna testa olika designlösningar. Du genomför tester och intervjuer för att samla in feedback och förbättra användarupplevelsen.
   

  

 I ditt arbete utgår du från våra beslutade designsystem, som du även underhåller och uppdaterar. Du kommunicerar designbeslut och samarbetar med andra designers, utvecklare och intressenter i olika förvaltnings- och projektteam. Du arbetar med att utforma användargränssnitt (UI) som är tydliga, enkla, relevanta, intuitiva, med hög användarbarhet för målgrupperna, som fungerar och är genomförbara i vår tekniska miljö. Du analyserar användardata för att identifiera förbättringsområden och mäta effekten av designlösningar.
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med olika förvaltnings- och projektteam. Ditt uppdrag är att designa enkla och intuitiva lösningar som fungerar och är genomförbara i vår tekniska miljö.
   

  

 Din bakgrund
   

  

 Rollen kräver att du har:
   

  

* Du har akademisk examen/eftergymnasial utbildning inom UX-design, tjänstedesign, interaktionsdesign eller annat lämpligt område, alternativt motsvarande utbildning eller erfarenhet som Arbetsmiljöverket bedömer som likvärdig.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att ha jobbat som UX-designer och kunskap inom Figma och/eller andra prototypverktyg.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med utvecklingsarbeten och förändringsprocesser inom digitalisering, digital utveckling och/eller verksamhetsutveckling.
* Minst 5 års erfarenhet och kunskap av metodik inom UX-och UI-design, behovsdriven utveckling, interaktion och att tex leda workshops och behovsutredningar.
* God förståelse för tillgänglig design och kraven på tillgänglighet inom offentlig sektor, såsom DOS-lagen och WCAG 2.2.


 Det är meriterande om du även har:
   

  

* Erfarenhet från verksamhetsförändringar som leder till mer datadrivna och digitaliserade arbetssätt.
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med liknande uppgifter i en större, komplex organisation, gärna inom offentlig sektor.
* Det är meriterande med erfarenhet av att driva förstudiearbete.
* Arbete med designsystem och designprinciper.
* Erfarenhet av AI-verktyg


 För att lyckas i uppdraget behöver du ha en stark egen motor, kunna kommunicera tydligt inspirera till förändring. Du är uthållig och har tålamod med att processer kan vara långa och/eller utmanande. Vid urvalet lägger vi stor vikt vid din personliga lämplighet och din förmåga att skapa goda samarbeten.
   

  

 En anställning hos oss kan innebära att befattningen placeras i säkerhetsklass. Säkerhetsprövning med eller utan registerkontroll kan därför komma att göras före beslut om anställning. För en del av våra arbetsuppgifter i säkerhetsklass krävs svenskt medborgarskap. Säkerhetsprövning genomförs enligt Säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585).
   

  

 Vad vi erbjuder dig
   

  

 Arbetsmiljöverket är en trygg arbetsgivare och en myndighet som hela tiden förändras med samhället vi verkar i. Vi är stolta över att få använda vår kunskap och vårt förtroende i vårt viktiga samhällsuppdrag. Tillsammans skapar vi en inkluderande kultur, som rymmer hjärta, mod och hjärna. Hos oss blir hela du en viktig del i något större.
   

  

 Anställningen är en tillsvidareanställning, på heltid och är för närvarande placerad på vårt kontor i Solna. Vi tillämpar individuell lönesättning och provanställning på sex månader.
   

  

 Vi strävar efter att alla medarbetare ska ha en hållbar arbetsmiljö och en balans mellan jobb och fritid. Därför har vi flexibla arbetstider eller tillämpar förtroendearbetstid och ger möjlighet till distansarbete där verksamheten så tillåter.
   

  

 Om oss och våra förmåner och villkor
   

  

 Så rekryterar vi
   

  

 Vi använder kompetensbaserad rekrytering, både för att kvalitetssäkra rekryteringen och för att motverka diskriminering. Vi ber dig därför att endast bifoga ett CV och svara på några frågor, istället för ett personligt brev när du registrerar din ansökan. Eftersom vi arbetar kompetensbaserat använder vi oss också av arbetspsykologiska tester i den här rekryteringen. Intervjuer sker från vecka 39.
   

  

 Vi tycker att det är viktigt att även du får göra din bedömning av oss. Därför välkomnar vi frågor före såväl som under rekryteringsprocessen. Fackliga kontaktpersoner är Adam Jansson för Saco, Eva Parissay för ST samt Jenny Bengtsson för Seko. Samtliga nås via Arbetsmiljöverkets växel: 010-730 90 00.
   

  

 Vill du jobba tillsammans med oss för att ingen ska bli sjuk, skadas eller dö av jobbet?
   

  

 Välkommen med din ansökan senast den 18 september 2025!
   

  

 Rekryteringen sköts av Arbetsmiljöverkets rekryteringsfunktion varför vi undanber oss säljsamtal från rekryteringsföretag eller annonssäljare.

title: Industrial Designer
company_industry: Defense and Space Manufacturing and Space Research and Technology
description:
Join our latest project!
 



  





 Do you want to design products that don’t just sit on a desk - but help enable satellite communications in space? We’re looking for an Industrial Designer who can combine aesthetics, usability, and engineering awareness to make complex technology intuitive and beautiful. This is a unique opportunity to shape the look, feel, and usability of advanced hardware that must perform flawlessly under extreme conditions. You’ll work at the crossroads of design and engineering, where your creativity directly influences how next-generation satellite products are experienced by users worldwide.
 



  





 This is a 12 month contract opportunity, with the potential for extensions. You will be required to work on site a minimum of 3 days per week, but ideally you are able to commit to full on-site presence.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Define the form, shape, and tactile qualities of the product
* Work on the UX/UI aspects of physical product interaction
* Collaborate with mechanical engineers to integrate design intent with engineering feasibility
* Ensure designs meet both functional performance and aesthetic quality
* Support material and surface treatment choices for desired user experience and appearance
* Contribute to prototype evaluation for look, feel, and ergonomics



  





**Essential Skills & Experience** 



* Strong background in industrial design with mechanical engineering knowledge
* Experience in user-focused product design (shape, form, and feel)
* Ability to balance aesthetic design with manufacturability
* Skilled in SolidWorks or similar CAD tools
* Experience working in multi-disciplinary teams



  





**Desirable Skills & Experience** 



* Experience with high-tolerance mechanical products
* Knowledge of surface treatments and materials for premium product design
* Background in telecoms, electronics, or technology products



  





 If you feel you could be a good fit, please get in touch!
 



  





 CMC provide expert engineering solutions on an international capacity for advanced engineering projects. Established in 2016, we set out our mission to be the best service-driven consulting business in global STEM markets, and after rapid growth in just a few years, we’re already delivering true expertise to major technology brands and leading companies around the world.
 



  





 As we expand our reach and take on new projects, we have assignments available for experienced embedded technology professionals to join our consultancy and deliver the expert solutions and high level of service we’re known for across multiple ventures.
 



  





 By partnering with CMC you get the chance to work with some of the world’s leading technology specialists. From our global offices we support you with each new project, providing a complete scope of work definition ahead of any engagement so you know exactly what’s required by the assignment, before you land on-site. As the project is completed we can continue to work with you by setting up your next project from our global network of leading technology companies.
 



  





 No terminology in this advert is intended to discriminate on the grounds of age or experience, and we confirm that we are happy to accept applications from persons of any age or experience for this role.

title: UX Design Manager
description:
**Craft:**
 UX & UI
   

  

**Job Description:**
 As UX Manager for a key product area in Candy Crush Soda Saga, you will lead and grow our team of UX Designers to deliver intuitive, joyful, and effective player experiences. You’ll guide the craft of UX across systems that shape how players interact with our monetisation and core gameplay features. By combining strong design direction with people leadership, you’ll ensure UX contributes meaningfully to product goals, player outcomes, and design excellence across Soda.
   

  

 Shape
   

  

 Your Role in Our Kingdom
   

  

 Line manage and support a team of UX Designers working across multiple product initiatives.
   

  

 Drive the UX vision for the Monetisation & Core area, aligning with product and creative goals.
   

  

 Collaborate with Product, Engineering, Game Design, and Analytics to ensure experiences are player-centric, frictionless, and impactful.
   

  

 Provide hands-on direction and feedback across the design process — from discovery through implementation.
   

  

 Champion best practices in UX research, flows, interaction patterns, and accessibility.
   

  

 Elevate the team’s design quality through coaching, critique, and development planning.
   

  

 Ensure effective collaboration between UX and other design disciplines (UI, Game, Economy, Level).
   

  

 Contribute to the evolution of UX practices and design systems across the broader Soda organisation.
   

  

 Advocate for player needs and usability in product decisions, balancing short-term delivery with long-term quality.
   

  

 Shape
   

  

 Skills to Create Thrills
   

  

 Strong experience leading UX work in mobile or consumer-facing digital products, ideally within a game or live-service context.
   

  

 Proven track record as a people manager, with experience growing and supporting designers through feedback and mentorship.
   

  

 Excellent interaction design skills and a sharp eye for detail and usability.
   

  

 Confident working in cross-functional teams, with a collaborative and proactive approach to problem-solving.
   

  

 Skilled in a range of UX methods, from research and wireframing to prototyping and user testing.
   

  

 Comfortable navigating ambiguity and prioritising for player value and business impact.
   

  

 Fluent in English (written and spoken)
   

  

 Bonus:
   

  

 Experience in mobile gaming or free-to-play systems.
   

  

 Familiarity with monetisation UX, economy flows, or live ops tooling.
   

  

 Strong visual communication and/or UI design skills.
   

  

**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Senior UX Design Manager
description:
**Craft:**
 UX & UI
   

  

**Job Description:**
 The Senior UX Manager at Level 13 is a cross-functional, strategic design leader who operates at the intersection of player experience, product outcomes, and craft excellence. You will be responsible for end-to-end creative leadership across a product theme or initiative, with accountability for the quality, coherence, and player impact of the design output. You lead through influence and ownership—not control—and you elevate both design standards and cross-craft collaboration.
   

  

 This is not a role for individual brilliance or decorative design. It’s for a systems thinker who can embed quality and player value into the core operating model.
   

  

 Shape
   

  

 Key Responsibilities
   

  

* Strategic Design Leadership


 Own the end-to-end creative vision within a product theme, translating strategic goals into coherent, high-quality player experiences. Drive decision-making on design principles, quality benchmarks, and experiential polish within the theme. Actively contribute to product strategy, shaping priorities, trade-offs, and constraints through deep design and player understanding. Serve as a key design voice in cross-functional triads with PM and Tech, ensuring design is a driver of product direction, not an afterthought. 2. Executional Craft and Systems
   

  

 Set the creative bar and ensure alignment with player-first and quality-first principles. Lead the design and rollout of scalable systems (e.g. design systems, UX patterns, interaction frameworks) that drive consistency and speed. Embed feedback loops within delivery, ensuring continuous refinement—not just delivery. Own and enforce the standard of “definition of done” from a design perspective: nothing ships that doesn’t meet it. 3. Team Empowerment and Growth
   

  

 Lead a small team of designers (embedded or centralized) across one or multiple initiatives. Coach, mentor, and elevate the craft maturity and ownership mindset of individual contributors. Create space for ICs to drive parts of the work while ensuring alignment with the broader design system and player goals. Drive peer feedback culture and ensure regular critique and quality elevation rituals. 4. Cross-Craft and Cross-Functional Collaboration
   

  

 Operate as a key driver of integrated collaboration across design, product, art, tech, and data. Define and reinforce shared rituals and processes that reduce hand-offs and duplication. Ensure design is deeply embedded from problem discovery to post-launch iteration. Actively reduce dependency on PM as the coordination hub; design should pull its own weight in driving progress. 5. Continuous Improvement and Cultural Leadership
   

  

 Actively challenge legacy ways of working—simplify processes, eliminate friction, and remove noise. Champion growth mindset: give and receive feedback, use data to disprove biases, and treat iteration as the job. Represent “One Soda” mentality: no silos, no turf wars—just collective ownership for what ships and how it impacts players. Model ownership, urgency, and rigor in all interactions.
   

  

 Role Expectations
   

  

 Scope of influence Area-wide or multi-team impact; key driver of cross-theme design standards
   

  

 Autonomy Operates independently; escalates only systemic blockers
   

  

 Output Ownership Accountable for both design quality and how well the design serves business and player goals
   

  

 Communication Frames design problems clearly, influences without ego, and drives alignment across functions
   

  

 Mentorship Directly grows ICs through structured coaching, feedback, and delegation
   

  

 Craft Elevation Improves not just outcomes, but the system that produces them (e.g. via playbooks, reviews, templates)
   

  

 What Success Looks Like
   

  

 Clear player value delivered in every major release within your scope. Design team members under your guidance grow in clarity, capability, and confidence. Fewer meetings, fewer approvals, faster feedback cycles—and higher design impact. Other disciplines seek your input early, not because they must, but because it improves outcomes. The product becomes more intuitive, cohesive, and delightful over time—and this is traceable to your leadership. Required Skills & Experience
   

  

 8–10+ years in product design, UX, or game design, with at least 3 years in leadership or principal-level roles. Proven ability to lead complex, multi-stakeholder initiatives from problem space to shipped solution. Deep fluency in systems thinking, interaction design, and player-centered development. Demonstrated ability to grow others, not just deliver yourself. Strong collaboration skills across product, engineering, data, and marketing. Comfortable with ambiguity, complexity, and change. Thrives in transformation.
   

  

**About King**
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Product Analyst, Mobility Vertical
description:
**THE OPPORTUNITY IN A NUTSHELL**
**You?** 
 You are an experienced product analyst with e-commerce, digital product, or marketplace background, bringing strong skills in SQL, modern data stacks, behavioural analysis, and experimentation.
   

  

**Role** 
 ? You will empower the Product teams to make data-driven decisions and drive product development through insights, instrumentation and experimentation.
   

  

**Tech stack?**
* Essential skills: Our tech stack includes Snowflake SQL, Tableau, and Amplitude. Equivalent experience with tools such as Power BI or Google Analytics is equally valuable.
* Bonus skills/experience: A/B testing, dbt, Python, Kafka, Data Mesh principles, Machine Learning, Google Slides.


**Location?** 
 Work hybrid, spending a few days a week at our modern offices in Stockholm, Oslo, or Aarhus to promote team collaboration. Prefer an office environment? You’re welcome to join us daily.
   

  

**Company?** 
 Vend is home to leading and loved marketplace brands across the Nordics — Tori, Oikotie, and Autovex in Finland; FINN and Nettbil in Norway; Blocket, Bytbil, and Wheelaway in Sweden; and DBA & Bilbasen in Denmark. Every day, millions of people across the region turn to our platforms to find what they need — whether it’s a job, a home, a way to move, or a fresh start. Together, our users generate billions of behavioural data points, which creates a unique opportunity to work with incredibly rich data sets while shaping the future of how people buy and sell cars, boats, and motorcycles. Currently, we’re in a historic change, consolidating to a common marketplace platform across the Nordics.
   

  

**The team?** 
 You will join the Mobility Insight & Analytics team: six product and business analysts and one data scientist, based across the Nordics. We support product teams and business stakeholders within the Mobility vertical i.e., Cars, Boats and Motorcycles. We collaborate closely with data platform teams e.g. Data and Analytics Engineers, and horizontal Insight & Analytics team.
   

  

**Why us?** 
 In this role, you will have the opportunity to make a meaningful impact by working with vast amounts of data from across the Nordics. Our marketplaces generate billions of behavioural data points each month, giving you the chance to uncover patterns, guide decision-making, and shape the future of digital Mobility experiences. We hold strong, unique positions across all our segments in the Nordics. Specifically, the Mobility vertical is driving transformation in electrification and the online buying experience, creating a dynamic environment full of opportunities. At our core, we unite across countries, brands, and teams, embracing a culture where we dare to speak up, challenge the status quo, and try new things. We take pride in delivering on our promises and turning bold ideas into real impact.
   

  

 Sounds like your cup of tea? Check out the details below!
   

  

**WHO ARE YOU?**
* You bring 5+ years of experience as a product analyst in e-commerce, digital product or marketplace companies.
* You have experience working with modern data stacks, behavioural analysis and experimentation.
* You are highly skilled in SQL and have an understanding and interest in the whole data value chain, especially from modelling business logic on prepared data to delivering and presenting impactful insights for stakeholders.
* You thrive in a fast-changing environment, balancing the need to maintain high data quality with the curiosity to dig deeper and uncover the bigger picture.
* Acting as the link between technical and business stakeholders comes naturally to you. You build strong relationships with colleagues and stakeholders, and value collaboration and shared success.
* You communicate data and insights in an engaging and visual way and switch between details and overviews to navigate complex business landscapes. You are able to explain data clearly at all levels.
* You turn vast data into actionable insights, elevating our understanding of marketplace user behaviour.
* You’re motivated by the opportunity to evolve alongside a company — and an industry — that’s constantly moving.
* A passion for cars, boats, or motorcycles is a plus.


**WHAT'S THE JOB LIKE?**
* Analyze and translate user behavior and product performance into actionable insights using product analytics tools.
* Act as an enabler for product teams across the Mobility vertical: advise on hypotheses, identify data and tracking needs, define KPIs, and ensure insights drive real impact.
* Help set up and analyze experiments to support data-informed product development.
* Ensure we maintain high data quality while contributing to continuous product evolution.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams (developers, product managers, UX, data engineers) as well as other analysts across the Nordics.
* Stay up to date on product development and analytics methods.


**What We Offer**
 At Vend, we offer a range of benefits designed to support your well-being, professional growth and work-life balance. Note that specific benefits may vary by office location.
   

  

* Learning & Development: Access to Vend Learning Lab, external courses, conferences, Hackdays, and leadership development programs.
* Health & Wellbeing: Comprehensive health insurance, mental health support, and other well being.
* Parental Leave: Enhanced parental leave benefits
* Pension & Insurance: Defined contribution pension plans and extensive insurance coverage, including accident, critical illness, and travel insurance.
* Food & Social Activities: Subsidized healthy meals, barista coffee, and various social events like after-work, gatherings, holiday parties, and family activities.
* Employee Share Saving Plan: Opportunity to buy shares with additional complimentary shares after two years.
* Home Office Support: Office equipment for home office setup.


**GOT YOUR ATTENTION?**
 We will review the applications
 **on rolling basis** 
 so apply as soon as possible, where you can share knowledge, learn, grow and make a difference. We value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds. Inclusion for us means creating a fair workspace where each of us is respected, celebrated for who we are, and given equal opportunities to thrive. Application deadline for this role is
 **1st October 2025**

title: Senior UI Artist | New Games
description:
**Craft:**
 UX & UI
   

  

**Job Description:**
**Role:** 
 UI Artist (Senior Level)
   

  

**Join Us on a New Adventure!**
 We’re looking for a talented and experienced UI Artist to join our New Games division at King. You’ll work closely with art direction, UX, and game design to craft joyful, intuitive interfaces for an unannounced mobile title. This role is suited for a senior-level artist with a strong understanding of UI in mobile games.
   

  

**Your Mission:**
* Design and build beautiful, accessible UI for mobile players.
* Collaborate with UX, tech, and game design to shape UI flows and user experiences.
* Create icons, menus, HUDs, overlays, and animations that feel fresh and readable.
* Ensure UI aligns with brand , tone, and art direction.
* Push polish and visual clarity while respecting constraints of mobile platforms.
* Help define and improve UI pipelines and best practices.
* Mentor other artists and foster a positive creative environment.


**What You Bring:**
* Strong experience designing UI for mobile games.
* Skilled in layout, typography, iconography, and motion.
* Expert with Figma, Adobe CC, and Unity UI tools.
* Able to work with UI prefabs, canvas setup, and implementation.
* Solid grasp of mobile user behavior and readability.
* A proactive mindset and team spirit.


**Bonus Points:**
* Experience with casual or stylized mobile games.
* Animation or motion graphics skills.
* Knowledge of Unity animation system or UI shaders.
* Familiarity with localization and scalable UI systems.


**Why Join King’s New Games Team?**
* Shape a fresh new game alongside top-tier developers.
* Collaborate in a respectful, feedback-rich culture.
* A fun, creative team that cares about players and each other.


 If you’re excited to build joyful and smart UI that feels right at home in a casual mobile game, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

****About King****
 With a mission of
 *Making the World Playful* 
 , King is a leading interactive entertainment company with more than 20 years of history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry, including the world-famous Candy Crush franchise, as well as other mobile game hits such as
 *Farm Heroes Sag* 
 a. King games are played by more than 200 million monthly active users. King, part of Microsoft (NASDAQ: MSFT), has Kingsters in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona, Berlin, Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles and Malta. More information can be found at King.com or by following us on LinkedIn, @lifeatking on Instagram, or @king\_games on X.

title: Creative Director, Product Area - Candy Crush Soda Saga
description:
**Craft:**
 Games Design & Production
   

  

**Job Description:**
 As Creative Director for a key product area in Candy Crush Soda Saga, you will lead a multidisciplinary team of designers to define and drive the creative vision that supports our product and business goals. You will shape the design strategy across game systems, content and monetisation. Ensuring our experiences are fun, intuitive, and impactful. By connecting deep player understanding with cross-functional collaboration you will guide the delivery of engaging, scalable solutions that elevate the player experience and deliver business impact.
   

  

 Your Role in Our Kingdom
   

  

* Lead and manage a multidisciplinary design team across UX, UI, Game Design, Level Design, and Economy Design.
* Own the creative vision for the product area, aligning design strategy with business and product objectives.
* Champion a player-centric design culture, balancing usability, fun, and clarity in all game experiences.
* Partner with Product, Analytics, Engineering, and Marketing to shape and validate features that drive player value and business impact.
* Drive consistency, cohesion and excellence in design execution across monetisation and core gameplay scope.
* Support design tooling, process improvements, and design systems that enable quality and efficiency at scale.
* Mentor and grow the creative team through coaching, feedback, and development planning.
* Collaborate with other design leaders across Soda and King to evolve creative practices and ensure alignment with broader strategies.
* Own key aspects of the employee lifecycle including recruiting, onboarding, performance management, and team health.


 Skills to Create Thrills
   

  

* Proven leadership experience managing creative teams in a fast-paced, product-focused environment.
* Strong design instincts paired with a deep understanding of player motivation and game systems.
* Demonstrated ability to align creative direction with business and monetisation strategy.
* Excellent cross-functional collaboration skills, with experience influencing product direction through design.
* Strong understanding of mobile UX/UI, game design principles, and player lifecycle.
* Experience overseeing design for both systems and content — from monetisation features to player-facing surfaces.
* Skilled in developing teams and cultivating craft excellence across disciplines.
* Fluent in English (written and spoken).


 Bonus:
   

  

* Experience in mobile gaming or other live-service consumer products.
* Familiarity with economy design and its role in engagement and monetisation.
* Hands-on design experience in multiple disciplines (e.g. UX, UI, game design).


*We love hearing from anyone who is enthusiastic about changing the games industry. Not sure you meet all qualifications? Let us decide! Research shows that women and members of other under-represented groups tend to not apply to jobs when they think they may not meet every qualification, when, in fact, they often do! At Activision Blizzard, we are committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment and strongly encourage you to apply*
**Our World**
*Our mission, to connect and engage the world through epic entertainment has never been more important. Through communities rooted in our video game franchises we enable hundreds of millions of people to experience joy, thrill and achievement. We enable social connections through the lens of fun, and we foster purpose and a sense of accomplishment through healthy competition. Like sport, but with greater accessibility, our players can find purpose and meaning through competitive gaming. Video games, unlike any other social or entertainment media, have the ability to break down the barriers that can inhibit tolerance and understanding. Celebrating differences is at the core of our culture and ensures we can create games for players of diverse backgrounds in the 190 countries our games are played.*
*As a member of the Fortune 500 and as a component company of the S&P 500, we have an extraordinary track record of delivering superior shareholder returns for over 30 years.*
*Our enduring franchises are some of the world’s most popular, including Call of Duty®, Crash Bandicoot™, World of Warcraft®, Overwatch®, Hearthstone®, Diablo®, StarCraft®, Candy Crush™, Bubble Witch™, Pet Rescue™ and Farm Heroes™. Our sustained success has enabled the company to support corporate social responsibility initiatives that are directly tied to our franchises. As an example, our Call of Duty Endowment has helped find employment for over 80,000 veterans.*
*Learn more information about Activision Blizzard and how we connect and engage the world through epic entertainment on the company's website,* 
 www.activisionblizzard.com
 *.*
*The videogame industry and therefore our business is fast-paced and will continue to evolve. As such, the duties and responsibilities of this role may be changed as directed by the Company at any time to promote and support our business and relationships with industry partners.*
 Activision is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, protected veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable law and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.
